Erlinda is 59 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to grow and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang, 32, is widowed and resides with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries since 2003, earning USD 6 per day. Each month she has to spend USD 30 on food,  USD 7on utilities; her child’s school fee is USD 5 and other expenses are USD 25. 

Samnang is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase construction materials to repair her house and build a toilet to be hygienic and more comfortable. In the future, she would like to construct a room for a Karaoke. Moreover, she wants to support her child to study until her child finishes high school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair her house and build a toilet.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married with three children. She is 34 years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. 

Anita sells "banana cue" (fried bananas on a stick) to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Every month she earns 3,000 PHP from it. 

She has requested a loan of Php 6,700 to purchase bananas, barbecue sticks and charcoal. In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she hopes to increase her savings for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, barbecue sticks and charcoal.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is married with three children. He is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. Marlon's business is successful. He used his previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Now, he has requested a new loan which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Positively, he hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 25, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and raising pigs for over 10 years, has extensive experience and is successful in her career, earning USD 1.50 per day. Her husband has been a construction worker in Koh Kong Province since 2007, earning an income of USD 5 per day. 

Each month, Pov has to spend  USD 27 on food,  USD 5 on utilities, cover her children's school fees at USD 5, and she has other expenses for USD 30. In order to make more profit and have a good living standard, Pov is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to buy rice to resell. This loan will help her to get more income to support her family. 

In the future, Pov and her husband want to raise a lot of pigs, buy more rice to resell, and build a big nice house. In addition, Pov wants her children to have a good education and have a good job.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell to get more income to support her family

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 54 years old and married with five children. Lina works very hard to provide for them.

Lina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Lina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, school supplies and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Lina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 60 years old and still has one child who is in school.

Lourdes has a fruit and vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell in her stall.

Lourdes has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money to build a restaurant in the market.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lorna has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, noodles and other grocery items.

Lorna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, noodles and other grocery items.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich, 48, is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice for over 20 years and is successful in her career. Her daily income is USD 1. Her children are working in a garment factory, earning USD $6 per day. Each month, she has to spend on food USD $25, utility USD $7 and other expenses USD $30. In order to generate more income for her family, Pich is requesting a loan of USD $600 to purchase cattle to breed in order to sell when they gain weight. In the future, she wants to raise many animals and she wants to build a new house. Moreover, she wants to live with her children in harmony.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and then sell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 50 years old and married with six children.

Lucena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Lucena has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from food vending and E-loading.

Lucena aspires to save enough money to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke rental business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy tools to upgrade her videoke unit.

Marcela has been in this business for 10 years. Marcela earns more income from her variety store.

Marcela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy tools to upgrade her videoke unit.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 47 years old and has seven children. She is married and has six children who are in school.

Marcelina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Marcelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 41 years old and married with five children.

Melodina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Melodina has borrowed and paid back 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Melodina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en: Nat, 34, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for over 20 years, earning income US $1 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, earning an income of US $3 per day. Each month, she has to spend on food US $30, utility US $5 and other expenses US $30. In order to reduce the reparation expense on her husband’s motorbike and to increase her income, Nat is requesting a loan of US $600 to buy a new motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi. In the future, she would like to run a grocery shop and build a new house. Moreover, she wants to support her children to study in high level.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам целеустремленный  семьянин. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 6 лет Рустам занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. В основном он выращивает лук и картофель. Он имеет арендованную землю и в данное время посеял репу и пшеницу. Он хочет переработать свою землю и хочет посеять картофель. В бизнесе помогает ему брат. Рустам  хотел бы получить займ в размере 700$ США для покупки семян, ГСМ и хочет оплатить за аренду земли.
texts.en: Rustam is a purposeful family man. His wife takes care of the household. Rustam has been growing crops for more than six years. Mainly he grows onions and potatoes. He has leased the land and at this time planted turnips and wheat. He wants to process the land and plant potatoes. His brother helps him in the business. Rustam would like to get a loan in the amount of $700 USD to purchase seeds, fuel and to pay for land lease.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fuel and to pay for land lease.

loans.name: La

texts.en: La, 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer, earning income of US $1 per day. Her husband is employed in a mirror shop, earning an income of US $4 per day. Each month, she has to spend on food US $25, on utility US $5, and other expenses US $40. In order to improve their living standard, La is requesting a loan of US $500 to buy ducks to raise in order to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her poultry farm. Moreover, she wants to build fences around her house and support her children to study to get a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase ducks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional stock of fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy slippers and sandals to sell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch, 56, is widowed and resides with six children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. Additionally, she is a Khmer noodle and fish paste vendor. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. Selling fish paste is the main source of income to support the family. Therefore, Touch requests a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more fish paste to resell to her clients. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children to study to get higher education.

loans.use: to purchase more fish paste to resell to her clients

loans.name: Zulay

texts.en: With the help of her first Kiva loan, Zulay was able to purchase fertilizers and also managed to buy one cow. Now she is applying for her second Kiva loan in the sum of KGS 100,000 to purchase two milk cows in order to raise her milk sales. In the future, Zulay plans to "broaden her household" by purchasing more cattle.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia is from Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, married and has one child. 

To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture, providing contract sprayer services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 10,000 a month for these activities. 

In 2004, Vergenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergenia is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the sprayer services provided. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand sprayer services provided

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is from Poblacion 2 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 63 years old. Samson is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Samson owns & operates a business venture, providing contract sprayer services to local community members. Samson has been in his business for 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2004, Samson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Samson is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the sprayer services provided. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand sprayer services provided

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en: Sinoun, 34, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province. She is a rice farmer and palm sugar producer. Additionally, she raises pigs at home to generate more income to support the family. Her husband helps her grow rice and produce palm sugar. Her oldest son is a construction worker. Sinoun is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more farmland to grow rice in order to get a higher agricultural yield. In the future, she would like to raise more pigs and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more farmland to grow rice in order to get a higher agricultural yield

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Nary, 60, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice and raise fish to sell. One of her children is a construction worker. Selling fish is the main source of income to support the family financially. Therefore, Nary has requested a loan of 400 USD to purchase more fish to sell in order to earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Oeurn, 41, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who grows agricultural crops to generate income. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. All of her children are employed: two are garment workers and one is a taxi driver. 
Due to more tourists coming to visit Cambodia, Oeurn is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a tuk tuk (motorized rickshaw) for her husband to run a transportation service for tourists. This loan will enable her to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk (motorized rickshaw) for her husband.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, 37, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is an egg vendor. Her husband sells snow ice, which is mixed with syrup. Her oldest child is a garment worker. 
Oun is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a machine to squeeze sugarcane to extract juice to sell. By doing so, she has a new business and earns extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to squeeze sugarcane to extract juice to sell.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim, 58, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is an A Kor vendor. Her husband is a rice farmer. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. 
Kim is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase tarantulas to sell to customers. By doing so, she can generate more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business of buying and selling tarantulas and run a new business breeding crickets to sell.

loans.use: to purchase tarantulas to sell.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 52 years old, married and lives in the Philippines. He operates a service-based business providing transportation services to local community member. He has been doing this for three years and earns 5,000 PHP per month from this work. He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle in order to offer a better service.
In 2011, Alberto joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, he hopes to gain double his current income from his business and see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle.

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsend-Ayush, 50, is a nurse in the state hospital in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been doing her job for 29 years non-stop. She lives with her two sons and husband in the slum district in Ulaanbaatar. 
Tsend-Ayush's older son Tseveldorj has been running a taxi business since 2009. He already has many permanent customers. But lately his car has been showing signs of old age and is now bad for taxi service. It is dangerous to his passengers and is a negative factor for his business' future. Therefore his mother Tsend-Ayush wants to support her son to replace his car with a new one. 
Tseveldorj wants to purchase a Hyundai-Verna, which is made in Korea, but he needs to cover its cost. The loan Tsend-Ayush is taking will be dedicated to covering the cost of the new car to improve her son's business.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a new taxi for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзаде 42 года, замужем, воспитывает трех детей. Муж работает слесарем. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Айзада занимается животноводством. Начатое с суммы в 8,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов. На сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеются две коровы, заготовлено кормов около 400 тюков и 2 тонны кукурузы. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Айзада обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух бычков. Доходы от кредита Айзада планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Aizada is 42 years old, married and has three children. Her husband works as a mechanic. Aizada does animal husbandry as a source of income for her family. She started her business with the amount of 8,000 som (KGS) and today it brings about 15,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy products. As of today she has two cows and prepared about 400 bales of fodder and two tons of corn. In order to further increase the number of livestock Aizada has come to the company Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of two bulls. Aizada plans to invest the income from the loan to increase the headcount which will allow her to increase her farm.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Roeun's Group

texts.en:
Roeun, 47, is married and has five children who are all still in school. She and her husband are maize farmers in the local Ratanak Mondul district. This has been their main business for more than ten years. Sometimes, they work for others for pay to better support their family. 
Roeun has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for three years while other group members have been with VisionFund from one to eight years. The loans have helped Roeun afford sufficient food and make a better living. She has paid back her loans from VisionFund. 
Roeun's group is requesting another loan. As the group leader, she wants to buy maize seed and fertilizer for her maize plantation. She hopes to grow more maize to earn a better income in order to improve her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy maize seed and fertilizer for her maize plantation.

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en:
Janeffer is a mother of five children, two of whom are in school and three of whom are adults. She is 47 and has been in farming for over 20 years. Her farm produces milk, maize and beans, all of which are sold to the local market.
Janeffer has requested a loan of 53,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the additional dairy cow will improve her farming income. This will enable her to educate her two children and improve their living conditions. She says her experience in farming and skills acquired in 20 years will help her get the best returns.
Janeffer says fluctuation in milk prices remains a challenge, coupled with high transport costs which compel farmers to serve only nearby markets.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
Saroeun is a 38-year-old farmer who has been growing maize and beans as her primary business for more than 20 years. She is a resident of a village in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Saroeun now has two dependent children who are still in school. 
This is Saroeun’s second loan with Kiva partner VisionFund while her group member Mom has just joined VisionFund for this loan. Saroeun is now requesting another loan with VisionFund, which she plans to use to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and make a better living in order to keep her two children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Savoeut's Group

texts.en:
Savoeut is 50 years old, married and has five children. All of her children work at the family's farm while still in school. Like other villagers near the mountainous area of the Ratanak Mondul district, Savoeut plants maize and cassava as her main income source. She has been in this business for more than ten years. 
Savoeut received a loan from Kiva partner VisionFund eight years ago. The loan helped her regularly afford sufficient food for her large family and enabled her to send her children to school. She completely repaid the loan to VisionFund. Now she is requesting another loan with her group members who also have been with VisionFund from two to five years. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her plantation. Savoeut hopes this loan will enable her to grow a healthy crop, increase her business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her plantation.

loans.name: Kimsok's Group

texts.en:
Kimsok is 40 years old, married and has no child. She is a villager near the mountainous area of the Ratanak Mondul district and has been growing maize as her primary business for more than five years. 
Kimsok has been with Kiva partner VisionFund since 2009 and she has been able to feed her family regularly. She successfully paid back her loan with VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan with her group members, who have also been with VisionFund from two to seven years. As the group leader, Kimsok will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her maize farm. She hopes to grow more healthy maize to increase her household’s income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her maize farm.

loans.name: Sarou's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of three dependent children, Sarou is now 38 years old and married. Currently all of her children are in school. Sarou has been growing maize in her village (where crop farming is common) as her primary source of income for ten years. 
Sarou received a loan from Kiva partner VisionFund seven years ago. The loan helped her afford sufficient food and enabled her to send her children to school regularly. She completely paid back the loan from VisionFund. She now leads a group of five members who are applying for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader of the group, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Sarou hopes this loan will enable her to grow healthy maize and improve her income in order to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en:
Chanthol is 30 years old, married and has no child. He is the breadwinner for his family, who are located in a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district of Cambodia. To make a living, Chanthol has been farming maize as his main income source for six years. 
Chanthol has been with Kiva partner VisionFund since 2009. His past loans have helped him afford sufficient food and buy basic household items. Having successfully repaid his loans from VisionFund, Chanthol now leads a group of three members who are applying for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, he will use his loan to buy maize seed and fertilizer for his farmland. Chanthol hopes to increase his crop yield and earn more income to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy maize seed and fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Winjoy

texts.en:
Winjoy is a resident and farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya. She is 30 years old, married and has three children aged seven, two and under one year. She has been in farming for over ten years and runs a cereals processing service besides farming.
Winjoy has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says she will use the extra income to improve the living standards of her family by providing for the family's basic needs. She will also save the rest of the income for the consistent improvement of her farming business.
She notes that insufficient water supply, animal diseases and pests are the perennial challenges she faces in farming. Winjoy appreciates the financial support from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 42-year-old married man. He has four children ranging from three to fourteen years old. He describes himself as patient and flexible. 
Stephen operates a retail store where he sells maize. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a conducive environment. In addition, he also runs a greengrocery to increase his income. He describes his biggest business challenge as the shortage of maize sources. He will use his loan of 20,000 KES to buy 15 bags of maize. Stephen's business goal is to be a supplier of maize to nearby towns within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of maize.

loans.name: Mruu

texts.en:
Mruu is a 25-year-old married man. He has two children aged two and five. He describes himself as honest and determined. 
Mruu operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, margarine, etc. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located at a potential and conducive area for a retail shop. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. Mruu will use the loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, etc. His business goal is to be  a wholesaler within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, maize, flour, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, aged 42, is married with four children, three of whom are still in school. She is a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya. She has been in farming for ten years. Her farm produces bananas for the local market. Margaret sees lack of rainfall as the major challenge she faces in her business. She also runs a second-hand shoe business for additional income.
Margaret has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets for a venture into pig farming. She says the market for pigs has been good due to the high cost of beef and the fact that many farmers have not ventured into the business. This makes her business prospects good. She will use the extra income to improve her other businesses and, above all, educate her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 53-year-old married man and a father of four children who live with him in Tyre. He has worked as a blacksmith for 37 years. He has a very good reputation, his work is unique, and he is talented in his work.
In 2002 Youssef opened a shop in Tyre. Most of his customers are loyal to him, so his business was not affect by the move. The new shop was larger than the old one, and it was possible for him to expand his business as he had more space for new machines and stock.
Youssef has taken a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua before for buying a new machine, and this reflected positively on both his social and financial situations. Now, Youssef is requesting another loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his iron stock for designing new frames and other decorative items.
Mahmoud wants to keep improving the quality of business and sees working to gain customers' loyalty as the most important part.

loans.use: to buy extra iron to design new frames and other decorative items.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha, 32, is married and has two children who also work on the family’s farm while still in school. Tha is a peasant who has been growing maize as a primary business for ten years, and she supplements her income as a tailor. 

Tha has been with VisionFund since 2005. The previous loans have helped her afford sufficient food and to make a living better. She completely paid back her last loan with VisionFund. Now she and other group members who have also been with VisionFund from two to five years are applying for another loan. 

As the leader of the group, she plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of the loan to buy cloth for her tailor shop. She hopes to increase her business and crop yield and also gain better income to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and cloth for her tailor shop.

loans.name: Sreyveng's Group

texts.en:
A dweller from a village of the Ratanak Mondul district of Cambodia, Sreyveng is 31 years old and has three dependent children who are still in school. To support her living, she has been farming maize as her main income source for six years, and she supplements her income by running a small grocery store in front of her house to raise additional income to better support her family and children. 

Sreyveng has been with VisionFund since 2007. The previous loans have helped her regularly afford her living. She completely paid back her loans with VisionFund. Now requesting another loan with her group member, Kosal, in the village, she will use this loan of $300 to buy fertilizer for her maize farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her maize healthfully and increase crop yield, and she also hopes to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her maize farmland.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old single man, working and living in Saida, in the south of Lebanon. He has been operating an auto repair workshop since 2008, during which time his business has grown steadily. He is well known in the region, and has a good number of clients who represent most of his relatives, friends and neighbors.

Ali is requesting a loan for the second time from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new car necessary for his newly established business. He has
started selling hardware, so he needs a car to buy and sell the hardware among neighboring villages, as extra income in his free time.

His previous loan was invested in purchasing tools and stock for his auto repair workshop, and it reflected positively on his social & financial situation that helped in starting a new business.

In the future, Ali hopes to open a larger shop next to the main road that will attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy a new car for his business.

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
Sum, 50, is married and has five children. She is a farmer in a village of the Ratanak Mondul district of Cambodia who has been growing maize as her only main income-generating business to support her living. She has been in this business for ten years, and all of her children work at the family’s plantation to help her earn a living. 

Sum's group loan has been with VisionFund for seven years. She successfully paid back her previous loans with VisionFund. The loans have helped her afford sufficient food and make her living better. She now leads a group of three members in the village who are applying for another loan with VisionFund. 

As the leader, she plans to use her $300 portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee for her farmland. Sum hopes to increase her business and earn a larger income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay a fee for plowing her farmland.

loans.name: Ermina

texts.en: Ermina is a 43-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be religious. She operates a store where she sells mangoes, avocados and cucumbers. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located at a viable area for the store. She describes her biggest business challenge to be disturbances by the city council. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase avocados, mangoes and cucumbers. Her business goal is to be a distributor of fruits within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes, avocados and cucumbers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee and bananas for planting.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 33 years old, married, and has three children. He has been running a timber supplies business for the last 15 years, earning a monthly income of about Kes 20,000.

He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET ltd of Kes 30,000. He plans to use the loan to purchase additional stock of timber. He will save anticipated profits to open another branch.

His hopes and dreams are to become a timber distributor and be successful.

loans.use: To increase the level of his timber stock.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 41-year-old hardworking woman. Seven years ago she started selling women's and children's clothes from her car by traveling among neighboring villages, searching for new customers and selling her products. Her business was expanding, so she decided to settle down, and in 2010 Zahra opened her clothes-selling shop in Tyre. Most of her customers were invited to the opening to ensure that they knew the place and would start coming over to buy their needs.

Today Zahra is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her winter clothes collection. It's her first time to experience such a loan. She is planning to expand her business more by starting to target men in the future. She is a perfect wife who works hard to help her husband in making their living.

loans.use: To increase her winter collection of clothes.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 51-year-old widowed woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 23 years to 34 years. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located at a ready and established area for dairy farming. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase a cow. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy a cow for milking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for himself.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a farmer in Nkubu and has been active in farming for five years. He currently sells produce of bananas, maize, cabbages, and milk to the local market. He operates a motorcycle transport besides farming. He is married with two children.

Erick has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy dairy goats. He had previously acquired loans of 20,000 KES and 50,000 KES which he repaid promptly. He says he will keep the goats for milk, as well as resell them for family upkeep. He is focusing on expanding his transport business as well.

He says the high cost of inputs remains a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 35 year old married man. He has a daughter who is one year old. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, tea leaves, Blue Band, cooking fat, etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located at a densely populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be ininsufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy tea leaves etc. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking fat, tea leaves, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement to sell.

loans.name: Dibson

texts.en: Dibson, a 27-year-old married man who describes himself as courageous, has been operating a retail store  that sells maize and beans for the past year. Located in a competitive area, his biggest business challenge is inadequate funds. Dibson will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy 10 bags of maize and beans, and his  business goal is to be a supplier within five years.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 40-year-old single man, who has spent his life planting and taking care of his flowers, tomatoes, grapes and olives. Ahmad loves his business. He's attached to his land and that's why he tries his best to keep on improving his business in order to produce good quality products to sell in the market. Ahmad is planning to build a greenhouse in order to keep his plants safe from any bad weather that might come. For this reason, he applied for his first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. Ahmad believes that he must treat his plants with care and love to produce the best quality products in the future. He hopes to increase production by producing different products and attracting new customers.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: 02-Đại Long-Hoằng Châu-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Thành is 49 years old. She is married and has three children. 

She is the leader of a four-member group, the 060302-Đại Long-Hoằng Châu-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2003, Thành joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thành has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thành works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Thành has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Thành faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to to purchase baby livestock to raise.

In the future, Thành hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 40 years old and married. She has four children. She has been in the farming business for the last 20 years, earning a monthly income of KES 35,200.

She is requesting her fifth loan with KADET Ltd. of KES 40,000. She intends to use the loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. With the anticipated profits she will hire additional acreage for farming.

Her hopes and dreams are to become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 58-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells items like canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar and soy sauce. Carmelita also works at their rice farm. She helps her husband grow and sell rice.

Carmelita has requested this loan to buy fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, soap and shampoo. Carmelita hopes that through her income, she will be able to sustain her children's education and improve their living situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Taj El Din

texts.en:
Taj El Din is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with one parent, his working wife and six school-aged children. He’s the one responsible for his family and doing the best he can to enrich their way of living. 

Taj El Din decided to start his own home business in 1995, so he opened a cattle farm and is looking forward to further growing his business. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase cattle and fodder in order to feed them. He notes that this will enhance his business and boost his productivity. 

In the future, he plans to enlarge his business and purchase added cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and fodder in order to feed them.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 49-year-old married woman. She has two children, age 18 and 20 years. She describes herself as social. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a viable area. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the clothes retail store. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more skirts and blouses. Rose's business goal is to be a wholesale supplier of clothes within five years.

loans.use: To buy more skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.en:
Apolinar is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child.
 
Apolinar has a junk shop that sells recycled materials like bottles, plastics and metals. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy recycled materials like bottles and plastics to sell.

Apolinar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Apolinar hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like bottles and plastics to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a forty-five-year-old married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children to attain high qualifications. He is a farmer who has specialized in commercial maize growing. He acquired money to buy land from the salary he used to earn as an employee of a tea factory. He has challenges of the seasonal nature of the crop and his dream is to diversify and grow groundnuts and coffee.

Francis needs the loan facility to pay workers to harvest his maize.

loans.use: to pay workers to harvest his maize.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 32-year-old Lebanese man who is engaged, living on his own. He hopes to get married and have children. That’s why he’s trying his best to enhance his life. He has been working as a sculptor since the year 2000. He has a beautiful style, awaiting the perfect time to promote his products and attract added customers. 

Today, he needs to borrow $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added sculpturing tools in order to develop his business thus increase his profits. In the future, he plans to open his own fine arts shop.

loans.use: to buy added sculpturing tools in order to develop his business.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 35-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is seven months old. He describes himself as customer-friendly. He operates a retail store where he sells sugar, wheat flour, salt, sodas, tea leaves, etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a residential area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

William will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, salt, sodas, and wheat flour. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, sodas, salt, flour.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Regina has a junk shop that sells recycled materials like plastics, bottles & metals. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy recycled materials like plastics & bottles to sell.

Regina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Regina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like plastics & bottles to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 21-year-old single woman.  She has no children yet. She describes herself as honest and caring. She operates a grocery store where she sells fruit and vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for 7 months. Her business is located in a residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more fruit, cabbages and tomatoes. Her business goal is to be a distributor of fruits and vegetables within five years.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, fruit and cabbages.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Prima has a junk shop that sells plastics, bottles & metals. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy recycled materials like plastics & bottles to sell.

Prima has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Prima hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like plastics & bottles to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy perfumes, blankets, jewellery and travelling bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stocks of timber and firewood.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

She is also continuing her buying and selling of jewelry like necklaces and bracelets.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.

loans.name: Karama Agahikaine Group

texts.en:
Nviri is a forty-eight-year-old married man with six children. He lives in Kyenjojo,Uganda. He trades in produce and has been in business for five years. He used to be a farmer and after realizing that farming would be a long process, he decided to venture into the produce business. He is happy with the decision. He has a challenge of price fluctuation. His dream is to own a food store. 

Nviri is a member of a group whereas per policy, each one guarantees the other in acquiring the loan. He intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 9 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be determined. 

Ernest operates a food stall where he sells fish. He has been involved in this business for fifteen years. His business is located at a residential area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more fish. 

Ernest’s business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers to weed her garden.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
64-year-old Eugenia is a married woman living in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She and her husband are both farmers. Even at her age, Eugenia can still keep up with the work required at the farm. Eugenia also said that she enjoys working at her farm. Eugenia hires laborers to help till her land and grow rice crops.

Eugenia has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Eugenia hopes for this loan to help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en: Nuru is a 41-year-old married woman. She has two children,  8 years and 16 years old. She describes herself to be customer-friendly. She operates a water retail stall where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds . She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy water storage containers. Her business goal is to own a big  tank to aid in the storage of water for resale within five years.

loans.use: To buy water storage containers.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 44 years old, married, and has six children.  He is a hardworking man who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a music system that he uses for entertainment through music performances, which he has been doing for five years. 

Fred is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy two loudspeakers so as to become more efficient. He dreams of building a permanent home and educating his children

loans.use: to purchase two loudspeakers.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 26 years old, single, and has one child. She has been running a green grocery shop for five years earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

Faith is requesting her first loan with KADET for 30,000 KES, which she will to use to purchase onions, potatoes, and watermelons for her business. With the anticipated profits, she will educate her child. Her dream is to own a bigger grocery stall and become successful.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe wants a loan to buy more beans, millet and simsim to sell. She is a 47-year-old, widowed woman with six children living in Masindi, Uganda. She started by making local beer that she would produce on a small scale. After acquiring enough earnings, she ventured into the produce business. Her desire is to build a permanent house and move her business to a more permanent location despite challenges in limited capital.

loans.use: buy beans, millet and simsim for sale

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 59 years old, married with three children ages 14, 17 and 20. Annie does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and has employed two people. She earns extra income from her farming activities. She describes her business environment as busy because many people visit her daily. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cloth materials.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials

loans.name: Molly

texts.en: Molly wants a loan to buy cosmetics for use in her salon. She is 36 years old living in Masindi, Uganda. She is charged with a responsibility of taking care of her five children. She desires to have a stable income source and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for use in her salon

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елене 41 год, замужем, мать четырех дочерей.  Муж Елены работает на стройке. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Елена  в 1997 году начала заниматься животноводством. Стартовав с начальной суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS), Елена смогла развить хозяйство с двумя дойными коровами,приносящее около 15,000 сом в месяц от продажи молока.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Елена обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Елена планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем мечтает построить новый дом для семьи.
texts.en: Elena is 41 years old, married and is a mother of four daughters.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Elena became involved in animal husbandry in 1997 to provide a source of income for her family.  Having started with an initial sum of 2,000 som (KGS), she was able to develop her business to have two dairy cows and yield about 15,000 som per month from sales of milk.  In order to further develop her business, Elena requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the profits into increasing livestock headcount further and dreams of building a new house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer wants a loan to buy a computer for her studio. She is a 48-year-old, hardworking woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She started on small scale but now her business has grown. Her desire is to educate children and expand her business to new markets.

loans.use: buy a computer for her studio

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 39 years old, married to Ismael, and they have four children. She has been running a beauty salon for the last three years, earning a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

She is requesting her first   loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 20,000. She intends to use the loan to purchase cosmetics and a steam dryer for the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a chain of beauty salons.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and a steam dryer.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
This is Haydee, 41, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Patocinio, a tinsmith, and she is mother to her five children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Haydee operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Haydee hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 49-year-old married woman. She has two children 12 and 16 years old. She describes herself as customer-friendly. She operates a general store where she sells sugar, salt, flour, sodas, bread, sweets, razor blades, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, salt, flour, etc. Grace's  business goal is to run a fully stocked shop within five years.

loans.use: To  buy sugar, salt, flour, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is acquiring a loan to buy chicken feed. He's a thirty-five-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a poultry farmer and his project has grown from 50 birds to 120 birds. Price fluctuations hinder his business and his dream is to own at least 2000 birds in the next four years.

Peter also dreams of building a permanent home and moving into new markets.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad, 51, lives in Quezon City, Philippines. She is married, has one child and earns a living by running a small convenience store where she sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to people who live in her neighborhood. She earns at least PHP 500 a day and is applying for a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her dream is to earn enough money to give her family a good life, and to help do this she meets regularly with her co-fellowship* members to share work tips and study religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet weekly to study religion, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en: Karim is a 31-year-old Lebanese man who is married and lives with his wife and two children. He is the sole breadwinner in his family and works as a salesman for a local company. He is applying for a loan for $1,300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s educational fees. In the future, he plans to take out more loans so that his children can get a good education.

loans.use: to pay his children’s educational fees

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en: Japhet is married and the father of two children. For the last five years, he has earned a living as a mechanic and earns a monthly income of Kes 25,000. He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET ltd for Kes 35,000, which he will use to pay his children's school fees. His dream is to educate his children through the university level.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Rasoa

texts.en: Rasoa is 34 years old, single and the mother of a 14-year-old daughter. She is a very social person and has for the last five years earned a living operating a stall where she sells food. Her business is located in a busy residential area, and her main challenge is a shortage of money to invest in her business. She is applying for a loan for Kes 20,000 to buy cooking oil, flour and charcoal. Her goal for the future is to move her stall into a building and turn it into a restaurant within five years.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en: Achol is 32 years old, married and has six children, all of whom are in school. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling food. She is applying for a loan from BRAC South Sudan to buy beans and rice to sell to her customers. She will use the extra income made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy beans and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en: Ayen is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children, three of whom are in school. She has had a food-stall business in Bor, South Sudan, for one year. Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and oil. She will use her extra income resulting from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and oil to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 40 years old and married. She has four children. She has been running a grocery stall for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

She is applying for her fourth loan (of 10,000 KES) with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the funds to purchase onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for the business. With the anticipated profits, she will cater for her family's needs and save to expand her business.

Her hope is to sustain her business and meet her family's needs

loans.use: to purchase stock of tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a 32-year-old married woman. She has three children, their ages ranging from 9 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be customer-friendly. She operates a restaurant where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for three years. Khadija also runs a boutique to increase her income. Her business is located at a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 20,000-Kenyan-shilling loan to buy ingredients for preparing more food. Her business goal is to run a bigger restaurant within five years.

loans.use: to buy ingredient for preparing more food

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy blankents, curtains, sheets and clothes

loans.name: Vrinia

texts.en:
Virinia is 28 years old, married to Andrew and they have one child. She has been running a fruits and vegetables stall for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.

She is applying for her third loan with KADET Ltd of KES 25,000. She will use the funds to purchase potatoes and tomatoes for the business. With the anticipated profits, she will educate her child and save.

Her hopes and dreams are to own a grocery store and become self-reliant.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegteables to sell

loans.name: Mutuaa

texts.en: Mutuaa is a 24-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 8 months to 5 years. She describes herself to be religious. She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a viable market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase more charcoal. Mutuaa's business goal is to be a charcoal distributor within five years.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna, 46, a resident of Manila and the mother of two children. Together with her children she manages the household while operating her business. She continually works hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

Myrna operates a sari-sari adjacent to her house. In the Philippines a sari-sari is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP’s worth of cooking oil or an egg.

Myrna profits by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Myrna is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be using it to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory, which she expects will boost her business.

Myrna dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and study the Word of God from which she draws strength and inspiration.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Becham Group

texts.en:
Mariam is in her late forties and single. She has been running a soft drink shop for five years now. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. and makes a good monthly profit.

This will be Mariam’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes to add more stock to her shop. Mariam will share this loan with her loan group, Becham, which totals fifteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Mariam’s dream is to one day be an international businesswoman and provide employment to others.

loans.use: to add more stock of  soft drinks in her shop.

loans.name: Douaa

texts.en:
Douaa is a 34-year-old single Lebanese woman. She lives with her parents and two working siblings. Her father is their main income provider and fulfills their needs.

Douaa started her own home business as a private teacher in 2005 and looks to further improve her work. She also has a parallel job at a local company.

Today, Douaa would like to borrow $2900 from Kiva’s partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a laptop in addition to an ipad in order to enhance her teaching abilities and gain added students.

In the future Douaa plans to open her own learning center.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop and an ipad for her work.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
This is Daisy.  She is 42 years old and a resident of Manila, Philippines.  She is married to Jacinto, an employee, and a mother to her five children.  Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business.  At this time, she is working hard to provide a consistent income to meet everyday expenses.  

Daisy operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages in small quantities to individuals in the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil or a single egg.  She earns money by acquiring supplies in bulk at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece.  She also sells cooked viand, or food items and tasty dishes, to earn additional income.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Daisy is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Daisy hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future by working hard on her business.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Kadii

texts.en:
Kadii is a married woman.  She has three children ranging in age from four years to 10 years.  She describes herself as being honest and passionate about her work.  

She operates a retail stall where she sells snacks, like doughnuts.  She has been involved in this business for one year.  Her business is located at a viable market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.  Kadii will use this loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to purchase more snacks.  Her business goal is to run a big hotel within five years.

loans.use: to buy more snacks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 33-year-old Lebanese woman.  She is married and lives with her husband and five children, who are all in school.  Together with her husband, she works hard to bring added income to the family and to pay the fees for her children to study.  

She has owned an accessories, bags and perfume shop in her town since 2009, where all ladies can benefit from her products.  Today, she intends to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to add additional items, such as perfume and many other products, to her existing inventory.  She expects that she will increase her profit by expanding her inventory of goods sold.  In the future, she plans to add clothes to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to purchase perfume and other products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stocks of onions, tomatoes and fruit.

loans.name: Arnauline Reack Mildrede

texts.fr:
Cette commerçante est une cliente de 30 ans,  mariée et mère d'un enfant de 4 ans,elle vend de la friperie il y'a bientôt 6 ans, quand elle arrête ses etudes en classe de première.Elle commence avec la vente de la friperie pour aider son couple.
Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des robes de fillettes, elle a su fidéliser ses clients et a des stratégies de vente  très efficaces, elle achète des ballots de robes neuves, qu'elle fait laver et vend chez ses clientes, dans le quartier et parfois dans les administrations.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va encore acheter des  ballots robes, surtout qu'elle est a la veille des fetes de noël.
Depuis l'obtention de son prêt,ses ventes ont largement augmentées, et elle épargne beaucoup et  fait des énormes benefices.
Elle a pour projet d'avoir un dépôt des ballots de friperie
texts.en:
This client is a 30-year-old vendor. She is married and has a four-year-old child. She started selling secondhand clothing about six years ago, when she stopped her schooling during secondary school. She began selling secondhand clothing in order to help her husband.

She has specialized in the sale of dresses for girls. She has built up a loyal customer base and has very effective sales strategies. She buys bundles of new dresses, washes them, then goes out to sell them to customers around the neighborhood and sometimes at public administration buildings.

With this loan, she will buy more bundles of dresses, especially since Christmas is right around the corner.
  
After having received a previous loan, her sales sharply increased, and she saves a lot and makes a large profit. Her goal is to one day have a secondhand clothing store.

loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is 25 years old and single. She lives with her parents and two working siblings. Her father is the one covering the family expenses. Samar has been working as a private teacher for the past four years from her home. She is intelligent and an expert in her field. 

Samar is requesting a loan for $800 from Ameen s.a.l., which she will use to purchase a laptop for her business. She notes that this will allow her to develop her way of teaching through her communication with her students. In the future, she plans to attract new students and expand her work.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a single 29-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his parents and three siblings, two of whom are working. His father works hard to enhance his family and children’s way of living.

In order to help his father provide, Mohammad started his own business as a DJ in 2007. He attends weddings and parties at customers’ requests.

Today, Mohammad wants to borrow $800 from Kiva’s partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new DJ equipment. This loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him to attend more events. In the future he plans to open his own music shop.

loans.use: to purchase new DJ equipment.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 54 years old, married to Ruth and has three children. He has been a carpenter for the last thirteen years, earning a monthly income of 67,000 KES.

Evans is applying for his first loan with KADET of 80,000 KES. He plans to use the loan to purchase additional stocks of timber for furniture making. With the anticipated profits he will build a family house.

Evans’ hopes and dreams are to educate his children to the highest level and grow his business so as to cater to upscale customers.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wood for furniture making.

loans.name: Kamaladdin

texts.en:
Kamaladdin is a 54-year-old person who is engaged in agriculture. He lives with his wife and four children. He has been in his business for 13 years. When he started to work, he had 10 sheep on his farm. First he applied to VFAC for 1000 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) to buy a cow and, to this day, he has finished and has 10 cows. 

Kamaladdin applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to buy 10 more sheep for fattening to sell at the bazaar. Kamaladdin is a hardworking and reliable person. As a result of his hard work, he has expanded his business.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep for fattening to sell at the bazaar.

loans.name: Lwambi

texts.en: Lwambi is a 38 year old divorced man. He has two children who range from 3 to 5 years old. He describes himself as commited and responsible. Lwambi operates a restaurant where he sells food, tea and snacks. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located within a residential area. He describes his biggest business challenge as the high cost of ingredients for food. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more ingredients for food and pay for the furnishing of his restaurant. Lwambi's business goal is to run multiple hotels within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food and pay for furnishing his restaurant.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26 years old and married to Naomi. They have one child. He has been operating a posho mill business for the last year, earning a monthly income of Kes 64,000.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. for Kes 80,000. He intends to use the funds to purchase maize to grind into maize flour at his posho mill. He plans to save the additional profits and invest them back into the business.

His hopes and dreams are to buy another posho mill and open a retail shop to sell assorted grains.

loans.use: To buy maize for his posho mill.

loans.name: Ajah

texts.en:
Ajah is a 28-year-old married woman with three children. Two of them are in school. Ajah has been selling food in a hotel in Bor, South Sudan for two years.
Ajah is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for sale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 41 years old and married with three children, aged 9, 14 and 17. She runs a retail shop where she sells maize flour, rice and sugar to earn a living. She earns extra income from farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her business into a wholesale business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 34-year-old married man. He has two children aged one and five.

Nicholas operates a grocery store in a busy residential area where he sells onions, paw paw, oranges, etc. He has been involved in this business for six years and describes himself as customer-friendly. A lack of money is his biggest business challenge.

Nicholas will use his 20,000 loan from SMEP to buy more oranges, paw paw and onions to sell. His business goal is to become a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to buy more oranges, onions and paw paw to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old, married to Christine and has four children. He has been selling housewares such as plates, cups and spoons for the last three years, earning a monthly income of 9500 KES.

John is applying for his first loan with KADET of 20,000 KES. He plans to use the funds to purchase more housewares to sell. With the anticipated profits he will diversify into farming.

John hopes to grow his retail business and be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase more housewares to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 26 year old and a married woman. She has three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling tea in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Monica is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 36 years old, married, and has five children. He has been operating a barber shop for the last four years earning a monthly income of 10,200 KES.

John is requesting his first loan with KADET for 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase a shaving machine, detergents, hair combs, and after shave. With the anticipated profits, he will expand his business. His dream is to diversify into farming.

loans.use: to purchase a shaving machine, detergents, hair combs, and after shave.

loans.name: Abiar

texts.en:
Abiar is 28 years old and married. She has three children, none of whom is in school. She has been selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for five years.

Abiar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more fish to sell. She will save her extra income from this loan to build a house someday.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a 34-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from five to thirteen years.

Josphine runs a stall in a busy residential area from which she sells water (previously she was selling sweets). She has been involved in this business for five years and describes herself as customer-friendly. A lack of enough water storage facilities is her biggest business challenge.

Josphine will use a 20,000 KES loan from SMEP to buy more water storage containers. Her goal is to own a lorry within five years to aid in water delivery.

loans.use: to buy water storage containers.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 33 years old and married with two children. For the past three years he has run a butcher shop to earn a living and has employed one person. He says his business is good because of limited competition.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Richard has been able to save his income. He has applied for a 20,000 KES loan to buy a cow for slaughter. He hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to  buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 75 years old, married, and has four children. She has been selling cereals for the last 26 years, earning a monthly income of 14,000 KES.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of 30,000 KES. She will use the funds to purchase maize and beans. With the anticipated profits she will diversify into farming and add more inventory of cereals.

Her hopes and dreams are to combine both cereal sales and farming together.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther, a 42-year-old married mother of two, has been selling cereals for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 6300. She is now requesting her first loan with KADET LTD for KES 30,000 to purchase a stock of cereals, i.e., beans and maize. With the anticipated profits, Esther plans to diversify into farming while still selling cereals.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of beans and maize.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, a 34-year-old married woman with four children ranging in age from 3 years to 10 years, describes herself as customer-friendly and passionate about her work. For the last five years she has been operating a retail stall located near a busy bus station where she sells clothes. Anna describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds.

Now requesting a loan for Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes, her business goal is to operate a bigger clothing retail business out of a permanent building within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ddc Group

texts.en:
Getrude, who is in his early 30s is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has a business of selling TV sets and DVD machines for one year now.  She works from 8.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
