В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Айзада обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух бычков. Доходы от кредита Айзада планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Aizada is 30 years old and married. She and her husband are raising three children, the youngest of whom is four years old. After having graduated from  college with a degree in philology, Aizada started working in the Zhan-Bulak village school, where she still works as an English teacher. In 2003, in the search of an additional source of income for her family, Aizada started raising farm animals. She had 15,000 KGS as her starting capital. At present her farm brings in about 15,000 KGS monthly from sale of milk products. Currently she has four dairy cows, 20 sheep, eight goats and four horses. In order to increase her cattle herd, Aizada turned to  "Bai Tushum &Partners" for a loan of 45,000 KGS to buy two young bulls. Aizada plans to use the resulting revenues to purchase additional animals, which will allow her to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and sells home products in the Philippines.

Maria requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy home products to sell to customers.

Maria has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to build a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 36 years old and married with three children who are currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Annabelle runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo and groceries in her sari-sari store.

Annabelle has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, eggs, oil, spices, bread, snack foods, etc. 

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Ma.luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa works hard to support her family. Ma. Luisa is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other materials for fishing.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es: La señora Gilda con 64 años de edad, habita sola en su propia casa. Ella posee una pupuseria la cual ha sabido adecuar en su hogar de habitación. Tiene mucha clientela ya que ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer carismática, trabajadora, dedicada y responsable. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de ella ya que con el tiempo y su trabajo ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos. A pesar de su avanzada edad no se cansa de trabajar ya que para ella su pupuseria es su principal  satisfacción. La ubicación del negocio es muy accesible y transitada. La señora Gilda es muy emprendedora ya que siempre está pensando en la forma de hacer crecer su negocio. Su sueño es poder cubrir una mayor demanda del mercado, por lo que ha decidido invertir en su negocio con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos que le permitan accesar a una mejor calidad de vida. Todo esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL ya que no cuenta con el efectivo suficiente para la inversión. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de los insumos necesarios (maíz, arroz, queso, chicharon, tomates, repollos, etc.) para la producción y venta de las deliciosas pupusas. La señora expresa estar muy agradecida con esta institución ya que en el pasado recibió la ayudo de dicha institución para invertir en su negocio. Espera recibir resultados favorables en esta ocasión.
texts.en: Gilda is 64 years old and lives by herself in her own house. She has a shop where she sells pupusas [stuffed tortillas], which she has managed to set up in her home. She has many customers since she is a charismatic woman, hard-working, dedicated, and responsible. Many people give her a good reference since over time and through her work she has earned the confidence of her neighbors. Despite her age, she does not get tired of working, especially since her pupusa shop is her main satisfaction. Her business is located in a very accessible, high traffic area. Gilda is very enterprising, especially since she is always thinking of ways to increase her business. Her dream is to be able to respond to an increase in demand, which is why she has decided to invest in her business. Her goal is to improve her sales and revenues, which will allow her to enjoy a better quality of life. For this reason she has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL, especially since she currently lacks the necessary capital to cover the investment. She will invest the loan by purchasing ingredients such as corn, rice, cheese, chicharrón [pork skins], tomatoes, and cabbage, etc., which are necessary for the production and sale of her delicious pupusas. Gilda is very grateful to the institution for the help she received from it last year to invest in her business. She expects to have favorable results again.

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, cheese, chicharrón [pork skins], tomatoes, and cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 33 years old and has one child who is in school.

Rosalinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other materials for fishing.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing net and other materials for fishing

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es: María Dolores tiene 40 años de edad y vive en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar, el cual está conformado por su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 18, 10 y 7 años de edad. Los tres se encuentran estudiando y son la inspiración de la señora  María. Ella se dedica al comercio de perfumería tanto para dama como para caballero. El negocio se encuentra ubicado en su hogar de residencia el cual  ha sabido adecuar de acuerdo a las instalaciones de su casa de tal forma que pueda atraer la atención de los clientes. La señora María es muy reconocida en la zona donde habita ya que se caracteriza ´por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y sobre todo honesta. Muchas personas prefieren sus productos ya que ofrece variedad, calidad y buenos precios. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingresos de la señora María, esto la impulsa a estar muy atenta y muy pendiente del rumbo de su negocio es decir trata la manera de estar siempre un paso delante de la competencia de tal forma que su negocio sea el líder en perfumería  en la zona. Todo esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL institución con la cual está muy agradecida por la ayuda económica que le brindo en el pasado para establecer su negocio. En esta ocasión solicita este préstamo para la compra de variedad de perfumería de tal forma de que los clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan y estén satisfechos con su servicio. De esta manera espera vender más productos y   mejorar sus ingresos que le permitan dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia; principalmente a sus hijos que cada día sus necesidades son más grandes.
texts.en:
María Dolores is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her family, which is made up of her life partner and their three children, ages 18, 10 and 7. All three children are in school, and they are María's inspiration.

She sells perfumes for both men and women. Her business is located in her house, and she has been able to adapt the business to the facilities in her house so she can attract the attention of her customers. In the area where she lives, María is very well-known for being a hardworking, responsible woman and above all an honest woman. Many people prefer her products since she offers variety, quality and good prices.

This business is María's main source of income. That motivates her to be very attentive and always watching the business's direction. In other words, she is always looking to be a step ahead of the competition so her business will be the area leader in perfumes. All this has led her to ask INTEGRAL for a loan. She is very grateful to the institution for the economic help it gave her in the past to start her business.

This time she is asking for the loan to buy a variety of perfumes so her customers always find what they are looking for and so they are satisfied with her service. In this way she hopes to sell more products and increase her income, which will allow her to offer better living conditions to her family, especially her children, whose needs grow everyday.

loans.use: to buy perfume.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is married and has two children. Elvie is 29 years old and resides at Liloan, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ, Philippines. 

Elvie owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2011, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Elvie wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Розе 50 лет, замужем, имеет трех детей. В 1979 году, в поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, Роза начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи мясных продуктов. На сегодняшний день, в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 5 голов овец, 6 голов коз и лошадь.   В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Роза обратилась в компанию «Бай -Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одного бычка и одного жеребца. Доходы от кредита Роза планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья домашней скотины, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Roza is 50 years old, she is married and has three children. In 1979 while searching for a source of funding for her family Roza started doing animal husbandry. She started the business with an amount of 15,000 soms (KGS) which today brings about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of meat products. Today her business has five sheep, six goats and a horse. In order to further increase the number of livestock Roza has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy one calf and one stallion. Roza plans to invest the income from the loan to increase the headcount of domestic animals which will allow her to increase her farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim is taking out a loan for her daughter, Hoai, who studies Korean language at Hanoi University. With the hope of becoming a translator for a Korean firm, she is trying to develop her language skills through the professors in the university. In order to become fluent in this language, her daughter wants to use a laptop. Therefore, Kim requires a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnamese đồng (VND) to buy it.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue is taking out a loan for her daughter, Lieu, who is studying accountancy at the Finance and Banking Institute. After graduation, she will work for a bank in the Bacninh province. To make her studying effective, Hue's daughter wants a new computer. Therefore, Hue requires a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnamese đồng (VND).

loans.use: to buy a new computer.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma, 59, is a widow from Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Delma has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 3,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

Delma is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Delma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide, 41, is married with six children and lives in Silanga, Tangub City, Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. Haide has been in this business for three years and earns 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2009, Haide joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Haide wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita, 32, is married with two children and lives in Silanga, Tangub City, Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years and each month she earns 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.

In 2009, Angelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Angelita wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a married woman who has four children. She is 40 years old. She lives in Bocator, Tangub City, Philippines.

Raquel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2011, Raquel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Raquel hopes to expand and improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 48, is married with two children, aged 15 and 20. She runs a tailoring business to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and  employs two people. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Grace has been able to improve her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. Grace has applied for a loan of 100,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy cloth materials.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, 47, is married with two children and resides in Mantik, Tangub City, in the Misamis Occidental province of the Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. Marites has been in this business for two years and each month, she earns 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP).

Marites has requested a loan of 14,000 to purchase products for resale. She has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Marites wants to expand her business and to ensure her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for resale.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is from Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Philippines. She is 49 and single.

To make a living, Dinah runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community such as candy, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many more. Dinah has been in this business for 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

Dinah is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Dinah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, 39, is married with two children and resides in Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Philippines. She owns and operates an area of farm land, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. Lilia has been in this business for 10 years and each month she earns 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) from these activities. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

In 2011, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Lilia wants to make improvements on her house and to ensure her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 42, is married with three children and lives in Dimalco, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns and operates a business venture raising crops to earn a living. Josephine has been in this business for 13 years and each month she earns 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) from these activities. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

In 2011, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements on her house and to ensure her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel is single and he is 36 years old, residing at Migcawanay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Ronel is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products including fish, crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. He has been five years in this business. Each month, he earns 5,600 PHP.

Ronel is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Ronel has is been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Ronel wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 22 years old, single and has two children. She has been running a retail shop in her locality for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,350.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd. of KES 30,000. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stocks of rice, maize flour and cooking oil for her shop. With the anticipated profits, she will purchase additional stocks.

Her hopes are to grow her business into a wholesale store.

loans.use: To purchase stock of maize flour, rice and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 62 years old and is married with five adult children. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past five years, she has run a retail store where she sells personal products in the local community. She earns 10,000 PHP each month. Lourdes joined GDMPC in 2006 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Lourdes is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 43 years old and is married with two children. She is from the village of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. For the past two years, she has owned and operated a bakery, selling baked goods in the local community. She earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. Leonila joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Leonila is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients to bake bread. She plans to use the income generated with her loan to expand her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to bake bread

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena is 41 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Efrena buys and sells home use products to earn a living and has been in this business for 11 years. Each month, Efrena earns 8,000 PHP. 

Efrena is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. In 2008, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Efrena plans to save her profit for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Luceriana

texts.en:
Luceriana is 41 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She is resident of Manila, Philippines.  Luceriana oversees operations of a tricycle transportation business. She has one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day. The regular customers are the local community. She earns about 300 PHP a day.

Luceriana is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP to help her continue operations of her business. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of her tricycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Luceriana dreams of giving her children a high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for and do maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is from Dalapang Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Melodina is married and has six children. 

To make a living, Melodina plants and harvests corn for sale. She has been in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Melodina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melodina is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jorinda

texts.en:
Jorinda is from Panta-on, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Jorinda is married, and she has 7 children. 

To make a living, Jorinda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. Jorinda has been in her business for over 15 years, and she earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2008, Jorinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and to thereby help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jorinda is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of this loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 66 years old and married with 3 children. He has been building rental houses for the last six years, earning a monthly income from rent of 20,000 KES.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET of 30,000 KES. He plans to use the funds to purchase building materials, such as timber, for construction of houses. With the anticipated profits, he will increase the number of rental units.

His hopes and dreams are to develop new rental units every year.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as timber

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is from the village of Tangub Cty, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 45 years old. To make a living, Emilia owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emilia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Emilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emilia has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Emilia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emilia from GDMPC. In the future, Emilia wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 32 years old, married, and has three children. He does carpentry to earn a living. He has been in this business for 11 years and employs three people. 

Nelson is requesting a loan 70,000 KES, which he will use to buy timber. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his standard of living. He hopes to be financially secure in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 29 years old, married and the mother of three children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by running a grocery stall where she earns an income of Kes. 18,000 a month. She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd., for 21,000 Kes., to buy vegetables and fruits, including bananas, oranges and cabbage, to sell to her customers. Grace will use the additional income she earns to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jeniper

texts.en: Jeniper is married and has three children. Jeniper is 36 years old and resides in Santa Maria, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Jeniper owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been in this business for one year. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this work. She requested a loan of 15,200 PHP to purchase products to resell. In the future, Jeniper wants to build a house and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 52 years old, married, and has six children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to educate her children. She hopes to expand her business to a wholesale in the future. She has applied for 50,000 KES to buy a bundle of maize flour and a sack of sugar.

loans.use: To buy a bundle of maize flour and a sack of sugar

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 22 years old, single, and has one child. She has been running a cereals retail stall for the last two years, earning a monthly income of 12,050 KES.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET ltd. of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy more cereals such as maize and beans. She will save the anticipated profits to increase her inventory levels. 

Her hopes and dreams are to diversify into farming and to grow her cereal retail business.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 26 year old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She runs a food stall in Dokuru bor, South Sudan, which she has been doing for one year.

Mary is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase onions and wheat flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase onions and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is 40 years old, married and the mother of three children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by sell clothing and now earns about Kes. 8,300 a month. She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd., for Kes. 20,000, to buy more clothing to sell to her customers. She will use the additional income made possible by loan to expand her business. Her goal for the future is to own a large boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 31 years old and single. He has been buying and selling cows and goats for the three years earning a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

Jonah is requesting his first loan from KADET for 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase goats and cows to sell. With the anticipated profits he will expand his business. His dream is to diversify into farming and grow his livestock sales business.

loans.use: to purchase cows and goats to sell.

loans.name: Anuar

texts.en:
Anuar is a 35-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. For the past year, she has had a business selling food from a stall in Bor, South Sudan.

Anuar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old single man, working in manufacturing metals such as aluminum windows and closets.

Ali is a hard worker.  He seeks perfection and improvement in his business.

Ali is energetic and talented. He has eight years of experience in this business. At the beginning, he started working with his brother. The hardest part in his working history was when he decided to split the businesses and start his own career. This step forward made him work hard to gain customers' trust and gain new ones.

Ali is improving his business as much as he can. To do so, Ali applied for a "Youth Loan" from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary glass requested for a project he had to accomplish. This loan is very necessary to his business. It will help in increasing his income and at the same time it will reflect positively on his reputation in the market.

Ali hopes he can expand his business more in the future, through increasing his customers and employees.

loans.use: to buy necessary glass for his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 33 years old, married and the mother of three children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by running a retail shop where she earns about Kes. 9,100 a month. She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd., for 20,000, to buy maize and wheat flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell to her customers. She will use the additional income she earns to expand her business. Her goal for the future is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy various food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Adut

texts.en: Adut is 26 years old, married and has one child who is enrolled in school. She earns a living by selling fish and is applying for this loan to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She will use the extra income made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sarlyn

texts.en:
This is Sarlyn, 37, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, a salesman, and is the mother of six children. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her older children's schooling up to high school level. At this time, she is working hard to send her children to school. 

Sarlyn operates an auto supply and car accessories business. What she basically does is buy car parts and accessories from wholesalers and sell them per item for a profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are car owners in the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 27,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of car parts and accessories to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sarlyn dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of car parts and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Somoire

texts.en:
Somoire is 44 years old and married to Sein. They have two children. He has been in the business of buying and selling goats for the last six years, earning a monthly income of 8,500 KES.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET ltd. of 20,000 KES. He will use the funds to purchase goats for sale. With the anticipated profits he will improve his business and also venture into farming.

His hopes and dreams are to increase the number of livestock for sale and improve farming output.

loans.use: To buy goats for sale

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Mr. Gantumur, 34, runs a taxi service around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been in this business for six years and already has had many customers in the past years. He lives with his wife and his two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Since last summer Gantumur has been building a new house in his backyard. But he has been faced with the lack of money to purchase the building materials. This happened because of his faulty projection of building costs. Now he needs over MNT 1,800,000 to finish building his new house. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary building materials to complete his house.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary building materials to finish building his house.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
This is Leonida, 60, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Romulo, her business partner, and is mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Leonida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Php worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leonida dreams to be able to give all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 42 years old, single and with three children.  She has been hawking used clothes for the last three years earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 10,000.  She will use the loan to purchase stocks of used clothes to sell.  With the anticipated profits she will increase her stock levels.

Her hopes and dreams are to own a wholesale shop for clothes.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 35 years old and married with three children aged 2, 6 and 9. She runs a retail shop to earn a living, and she has been in the business for 14 years. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. She earns extra income from her farming activities.

 Since she joined Faulu Kenya Patricia has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her business to wholesale and be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, rice, maize flour, bars of soap and sodas.

loans.use: To buy  sugar, rice, maize flour, bars of soap, and sodas.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. She is married and sells ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines.

Janet requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell. Janet has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: 74-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thiện works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to to purchase pigs and chickens and ducks to raise.

Thiện is 56 years old and she is married with four children. Thiện is the group leader of the 03.7.74.Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, and she has no dependents

In 2010, Thiện joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thiện has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thiện has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thiện faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thiện hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and she hopes her children will find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and chickens and ducks to raise.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This is Ali, a 40-year-old married man, who has spent 30 years working at polishing floor tiles. He was very young when he first started working, because he had to help his parents earn a living. Ali is a father of two children. He works hard to avoid having them repeat his harsh childhood. His wide experience gives him customers' support and trust, which helps a lot in his construction field.

Ali is applying for a loan from KIVA partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a special stair-polishing machine that is very helpful for him in making his business easier. This is Ali's second loan with Al Majmoua; his previous loan helped a lot in doing necessary maintenance on his existing polisher.

Ali hopes to buy another new updated machine in the future to make his business easier and more professional.

loans.use: To buy a special new tile-polishing machine.

loans.name: Easther

texts.en:
Easther is 37 years old, married, and has two children ages 8 and 14. She makes soap to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years. She describes her business environment as good because she has many customers. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Easther has been able to grow her business. She hopes to expand her business to a big soap-making company in the future. She has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy chemicals for soap making.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for soap-making.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is a 25-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has had a food-selling stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is 21 years old, single, and has two dependents. He has been selling second-hand clothes for the last two years with an average monthly income from the business of KES 9,000.

He is borrowing his first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000, which he plans to use to purchase bales of second-hand clothes. With the anticipated profits he will open another branch.

His hopes and dreams are to become a successful businessman and a responsible parent and also to be useful in his county (administrative unit for local government) economic-wise.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: 06.06.04-Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương has a retail business selling dry food and other things such as sugar, salt, fish and sauce.  She is requesting a loan to purchase further products to resell.

Phương is 41 years old and she is married with two children.  She is the group leader of the 06.06.04-Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of three members.  Phương lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Phương joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Phương has successfully repaid two loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She has been involved in her business for more than ten years. The main harship that Phương faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Phương hopes for her children to do well in school, to make enough money to provide for her children and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and other things such as sugar, salt, fish and sauce to resell.

loans.name: Aluel

texts.en:
Aluel is 35 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom attend school. She has a food stall in Dokuru bor, South Sudan, which she has had for two years.

Aluel is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions.

loans.name: Maria Eileen

texts.en:
This is Maria Eileen, 30, a resident of Bacoor in the neighborhood of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Fransales, a vendor, and the mother of two children. Together with her husband and children, she manages the household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies.

Maria Eileen operates a market stall. She sells cooking products and condiments at the community market. She buys quantities of these products and sells them per kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

Maria Eileen is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be using it to buy more cooking products and condiments in bulk to expand her product inventory. Through this loan she expects a boost in her business income.

Maria Eileen dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets with her CCT co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more cooking products and condiments in bulk.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.en:
Zacarias is a 52-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He is a farmer who primarily grows rice crops to sell. Zacarias earns about 3000 PHP per month through farming. He works hard to keep his crops healthy and increase his harvest.

Zacarias also started a sari-sari store that his wife now manages. They sell items like canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, shampoo and soap.

Zacarias has requested this 15,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer for his farm and more items to sell such as canned goods, cooking oil and vinegar. He hopes that through his work he will be able to improve his family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm and more items to sell in his sari-sari.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is thirty years old and a married woman. She has three children, one of whom is in school. She has been selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Achol is requesting this 1200 SDG loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more fish. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her child’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
This is Felimon, 54, a resident of Silang, a neighborhood of Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Veronica, a housewife and mother to their four children. Together with his wife, Felimon manages their household while operating a business. He works hard to sustain himself and continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Felimon sells rice cake snacks in his neighborhood. He buys rice flour in the market in the morning along with with other ingredients he needs like margarine, sugar and coconut. He cooks and prepares the snacks, then sells them in the afternoon. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Felimon is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan from CCT. He will be using the loan to buy the ingredients he needs in his business. He expects a boost in income as he expands his business.

Felimon hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients he needs in his business.

loans.name: 040106-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh operates a business selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase a fishing net. 

Minh is 40 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 040106-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She has two dependents

In 2003, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Minh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Minh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Quang

texts.en:
Ms Luong is taking out a loan for her son Quang, who is a first-year student at the Food Industry College. He is studying in the Finance and Banking faculty. After he graduates in 2014, he will find a job as a bank employee. To achieve this goal, he studies hard. 

His mother wants to borrow 14,580,000 Vietnamese Dong to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 31 years old, married, with one child. She runs a retail shop to earn a living, and has been in the business for three years. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to grow her business. She hopes to expand her business to  wholesale in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Akol

texts.en:
Akol is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has a business selling food from a stall in Bor, South Sudan. 

Akol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and beans. She will use the extra income she generates as a result of this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: 040104-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yến operates a fishing business. She is requesting a loan to to purchase a fishing net. 

Yến is 32 years old and she is married with 3 children who depend on her. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 040104-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. 

In 2003, Yến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Yến has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Yến has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Yến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Yến hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to buy a cell phone.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Akuch

texts.en:
Akuch is a 32-year-old married woman with two children, both of them in school. She has had a business selling food out of a stall in Bor, South Sudan for five years.

Akuch is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans for sale.

loans.name: 030712-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thơm works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle and poultry to raise.

Thơm is 33 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 030712-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Thơm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thơm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thơm has been involved in this business for 6 years. The main hardship that Thơm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thơm hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and poultry to raise.

loans.name: 030713-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

Lan is 40 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 030713-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Lan hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Awal

texts.en:
Awal is a 30-year-old married woman with two children; one is in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Awal is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: 030714-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bích works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

Bích is 31 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 030714-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Bích joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Bích has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bích has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Bích faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Bích hopes to travel for vacation within the country, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Papy Kelard

texts.fr:
Ce client est âgé de 32 ans, il a deux enfants. Après ses études de lycée, il s’inscrit dans une école de styliste, à la fin cette formation, il ouvre son centre de couture  où il forme des filles mère à la couture.

Afin d’agrandir son  activité et d’améliorer ses structures, il sollicite un deuxième crédit.
Avec ce deuxième  crédit, il va renforcer son activité en achetant : 2 machines à coudre, 10 rouleaux de métrage, de tissus, 5 bobines de fil à coudre, des boites à canette
Avec le crédit de Hope, le client fait maintenant face à tous les besoins de sa famille y compris le financement des études de son enfant
texts.en: This borrower is 32 years old and has two children.  At the end of high school he enrolled in a fashion design school.  After graduation, he opened his own sewing center where he trains unwed mothers and teaches them how to sew.  In order to expand his business and to improve its structures, he is now requesting a second loan.  With this new loan, he is planning to strengthen his business by purchasing two sewing machines, ten rolls of fabrics, five reels of thread and some spools.  Thanks to his previous loan from Hope, this borrower is now able to take care of all his family needs, and can pay for his child's school tuition.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines, fabrics and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Arnaud Junior

texts.fr:
Ce client est âgé de 25 ans il est celibataire et a un enfant d'une année maintenant,il a eu son bac il y'a plusieurs années, ne pouvant faire des etudes universitaires , il s'inscrit dans une école de pâtisserie et a l'obtention de son certificat , il ouvre une petite pâtisserie pour fabriquer des croissants, des pains au lait, pain au chocolat, des madeleines , des croissants...
Ses ventes ont largement augmentées, a l'heure actuelle , il a en moyenne 50.000 frs a 125.000 frs par jour.
Comme il fait ses achats en gros, il ne connait plus de rupture en stock et il a élargi son activité, parce qu'il fait des livraisons de domicile a domicile et a ouvert aussi un réseau  de gâteaux dans certaines boutiques d'alimentation et cantines scolaires .
Avec son nouveau prêt, il va acheter 5 sacs de farine , 2 sacs de 50 kg de sucre, des pots de margarine , 5 cartons d'œufs, des arômes et des pots de chocolat . Pour elargir son activité, il a prit deux jeunes apprentis qui l'aider a  travailler 

Il a l'ambition d'atteindre son objectif celui d'ouvrir un salon de the et acheter des équipements pour améliorer ses conditions de travail.
texts.en:
This client is 25 years old. He is unmarried, has a 1-year-old son, and graduated from high school a few years ago. Not having had the means to attend a university, he enrolled in a school for making pastries and, after obtaining his diploma, opened a small bakery in which he sells croissants, pains au lait, chocolate croissants, madeleines, etc.
His sales have greatly increased; he now makes about 50,000 frs to 125,000 frs per day.
As he buys wholesale, he no longer runs out of stock and he has expanded his business, since he does at-home deliveries and sells cakes in a network of food stores and schools.
With this new loan, he will buy 5 bags of flour, 100 kg of sugar, margarine pots, 5 boxes of eggs, flavorings, and chocolate. To expand his business, he has taken 2 apprentices to help him.
He wants to reach his goal of opening a tea house and buying new equipment to improve his working conditions.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of flour, 100 kg of sugar, margarine pots, 5 boxes of eggs, flavorings, and chocolate.

loans.name: 030816-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quây works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise. 

Quây is 55 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 030816-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She has no dependents

In 2010, Quây joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Quây has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Quây has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Quây faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Quây hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: 0402011-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mão operates a fish-selling business. She is requesting a loan to purchase a fishing net. 

Mão is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 0402011-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, and has one dependent. 

In 2007, Mão joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Mão has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mão has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Mão faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Mão hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Arjielyn

texts.en:
Arjielyn is 34 years old and lives in San VIcente Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children. 

Arjelyn has a motorcycle rental business with two motorbikes, and earns approximately PHP 5,250 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase equipment for her motorcycle transport business. 

Arjielyn has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Arjielyn hopes to buy a brand new car and to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 34-year-old married woman. She has four children and all of them are in school. For the past three years, she has had a business in Bor, South Sudan, selling charcoal. 

Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 56 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto,Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. 

Jessie has a general store and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Jessie has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Jessie hopes to earn money for her and her family's future. Jessie owns a van and she is a good mother and a loving wife.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married with 3 children. Norma is 47 years old and lives in Mauswagon, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Norma owns a general store which is how she makes a living. She has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 from the store. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Norma has been a member of PMPC for more than 2 years. In the future, Norma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 32 years old, married, with two children aged two and four. 

He runs a retail shop to earn a living, and has been in the business for eight years. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save his income. He hopes to expand his business to wholesale in the future. He has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou est un homme âgé  de 27ans. Il est marié å un/e couturière. Il a 01enfant.
Kokou travaille comme soudeur depuis 2004. Il travaille seul et achète les matériaux de travail à Lomé. Il a un atelier dans un quartier de la place.
Kokou a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des matériaux de travail pour mieux répondre à ses clients. Il veut voir son activité prospérer afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kokou, 27, is married to a seamstress. He has 1 child.
Kokou has been working as a welder since 2004. He works alone and buys his supplies in Lomé, where he has a workshop.
Kokou is applying for a first loan from WAGES in order to buy welding supplies and better meet the needs of his customers. He would like to see his business prosper so that he can better take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy welding supplies.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo est  un homme âgé de 46 ans. Il est marié å une couturière. Il a 03 enfants. 
Kodjo travaille comme déclarant en douanes et revendeur  de boisson locale depuis 2006. Il vend à domicile à ses clients après achat dans les localités de la ville de Lomé.
Kodjo a requis son crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la boisson locale. Dans les prochaines années, Kodjo voudrait augmenter son stock afin de répondre aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kodjo, 46, is married to a seamstress. He has 3 children.
Kodjo works as a customs broker and has been selling the local drink, Sodabi (a palm wine liqueur) since 2006. He sells it to his cutsomers door-to-door, after buying it in various districts of the city of Lomé.
Kodjo is applying for this loan from WAGES in order to buy some sodabi. In the coming years, Kodjo would like to increase his stock in order to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy some sodabi (palm wine liqueur)

loans.name: Mansur

texts.ru:
Mansur jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Mansur 31 qod. 
On uchitel po Fizike uje 4 qoda, ranshe on prepodoval v gosudarstvennoy shkole , no zatem on nachal provodit chasniye uroki dlya postupleniya uchenikov v universiteti. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye testi, knigi i razniye pribori dlya provojdeniya laborotornix rabot(opitov) po fizike tak kak vse eto stoit ochen dorogo i ne kaydiy uchenik mojet pokupat ix. Mansur lubit svoyu rabotu i predmet kotoriy uchit detyam kotoriy budet nujen dlya ixnego budushego razvitiya.
texts.en: Mansur lives in the Baku region with his parents.  He is not married and has no children.  Mansur is 31 years old.  He has been teaching physics for four years.  He previously taught at a public school, but then started to teach private lessons to prepare students for universities.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to purchase necessary exams, books and various equipment to do laboratory work (experiments) for physics because all of this is very expensive, and not every student is able to purchase it.  Mansur loves his work and subject that he teaches to children, knowing that it will be useful for their future development.

loans.use: to purchase necessary books and exams

loans.name: Karimjon

texts.ru: Каримджон активный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и имеет одного сына. Более 8 лет занимается предоставлением компьютерных услуг, распечаткой фотографий и монтажей свадебных мероприятий. Его пункт по приему заказов находиться в центре города. Каримджон хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. С этой целью  Каримджон запрашивает займ для покупки цветного тонера. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие. Спасибо большое за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Karimjon is an active and hardworking person.  He is married and has one son.  He has been involved in providing computer services, printing photographs and wedding events montage for over eight years.  His order acceptance outlet is located in the city center.  Karimjon wants to expand his business and make a good profit.  With this goal in mind, Karimjon is requesting this loan to purchase color toner.  He relies on your help and mercy.  Thank you for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase color toner

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comite lleva por nombre Maria Auxiliadora, debido a que hay una capilla cerca de sus casas, han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo y trabajar bajo un marco de responsabilidad  mutua. Actualmente se encuentran en el noveno ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, integrada por 14 mujeres muy luchadoras.
Amada es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, quien se esfuerza día a día por darle lo mejor a su familia. Ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de leche, lo que hace desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, ya que tiene que llevar su producto para la hora del desayuno. Su meta es poder tener un local donde ofrecer su leche.
Ella pide la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya y de kiva, para la compra de leche, y de esa forma tener un buen stock para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee is called Maria Auxiliadora, after a chapel near their homes. They have made the commitment to keep the group united and work under the framework of mutual responsibility. They are now in their ninth cycle in the Mujeres Emprendadoras [Enterprising Women] program of the Fundación Paraguaya, made up of 14 women who are fighters.  

Amada is a hardworking woman who is a fighter. She works every day to giver her family the best. She tells us that she sells milk, which she does from very early in the morning, since she has to get her product out for the breakfast time. Her goal is to have a locale where she can sell her milk.  

She is asking the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for help to buy milk. this way, she will have a good stock to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk to later sell

loans.name: Sahil

texts.en:
Sahil has two businesses to support his family. He owns six cattle and runs a taxi-driving service. He has been doing this for about nine years. The members of his family help with the agriculture business. He sells the milk, cheese, yogurt and butter in his village and at the bazaar. His plans for the future are to help each member of his family start their own business. 

Sahil is applying for a loan of 1000 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) to help his son to buy musical instruments, to help his eldest son to build a business, and to keep his own business in progress.

loans.use: to support his dairy business and buy musical instruments for his son.

loans.name: Kuña Paraguaya Group

texts.es:
Kuña Paraguaya es el grupo formado por 13 mujeres de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ellas son personas que tienen muchos objetivos y metas, sueñan con un mejor futuro para sus hijo y familiares, por lo que luchan incansablemente. Actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Ninfa es una de las miembros del grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, por medio de su arduo trabajo ha logrado mantener a su familia, y ayudarlos para que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones. Su meta es tener un amplio local donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella acude a la fundación y a kiva para pedirles ayuda, pues desea un crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, lo cual la ayudará a tener mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kuña Paraguaya is a group of 13 women in the city of Paraguarí. They are people with a lot of objectives and goals. They dream of a better future for their children and families, and for that they fight tirelessly. At present, they are in their second cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras [Enterprising Women] program of the Fundación Paraguaya.

Ninfa is one of he members of the group. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman. Through her arduous work she has been able to support her family and help them so they lack nothing. Her goal is to have a large locale where she can offer her clothing and in this way keep growing to keep helping her family. 

She came to the Foundation and to Kiva to ask for help because she wants a loan to buy summer clothing, which will help her have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing to later sell

loans.name: Yusif

texts.ru:
Yusif 53 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey kotoriye uje okonchili shkolu i uchatsya v universitete, tolko mladshiy sin yesho uchitsya v kolledje. Yusif 14 let kak rabotayet uchitelem, on okonchil universitet i posle chego nachal srazu rabotat. Yusif ochen lubit svoyu rabotu , on lubit pripodovat detam, uchit ix i obshatsya snimi s terpeniyem, ponimaniyem i uvajeniyem. Yusif seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye veshi dlya uroka yego prepodovaniya, on xochet kupit razniye knigi dlya obucheniya , dosku dlya obyasneniya zadaniy detyam i t.d. 
On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Lachin, seychas projivayet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 

Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов).
texts.en:
Yusif is 53 years old.  He is married and has three children, all of whom already finished school and attend a university, except for the youngest son, who still attends a college.  Yusif has been working as a teacher for 14 years.  He graduated from a university and started working right after.  Yusif loves his work very much and loves teaching children.  He teaches and interacts with them with patience, understanding and respect.  Currently, Yusif needs 2000 AZN to purchase necessary items, such as various books for education, writing boards for explaining homework to children, etc, for the classes that he teaches.  He is an IDP from Lachin and now lives in the Baku region with his family.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is a person, who was forced to suddenly flee his home as a result of a military conflict, violence, violation of human rights, natural disasters or other catastrophes, but what differentiates him from a refugee is the fact that did not cross an international border and is located on the territory of his own country (source: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to purchase necessary supplies for teaching classes

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en: Rajab is a 44-year-old man who sells animals and milk products. He started his business in 1995, and today he owns three head of cattle and five sheep. He is planning to expand his business to buy more animals in the future. Being a responsible and reliable person, he achieves his goals. Now Rajab wants to obtain a loan of 300 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) to buy construction materials to repair his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Agnetta

texts.en: Agnetta is 41 years old, married with four children aged six, eleven, thirteen and sixteen. She sells cereals such as peas and beans as well as onions to earn a living. She has been in the business for 15 years. She earns extra income from her farming activities. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cereals such as peas and beans and onions.

loans.use: To buy cereals such as peas and beans and onions.

loans.name: Adut

texts.en:
Adut is a 25-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in South Sudan for the past two years.

Adut is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Emad

texts.en: Emad is a 38-year-old man and is married to a schoolteacher. Emad works as a distributor. He organizes his time to distribute food and snacks to the schools’ cafeterias and to buy clothes at a wholesale price and distribute it to shops in the market. Emad has applied for a loan to increase the quantity of clothes he buys so he can expand in the market.

loans.use: To buy more clothes at a wholesale price

loans.name: Akeer

texts.en:
Akeer is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. For the past two years, she has been selling charcoal in South Sudan. 

Akeer is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Puertas Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
El grupo puertas del futuro es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está integrado por 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, ellas son todas amigas y vecinas del barrio. Actualmente se encuentran en el décimo tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas con mucho sacrificio y trabajo están sobresaliendo y desean seguir haciéndolo.
Vicenta es peluquera y nos cuenta que es muy buena, es por ello que siempre tiene buena cantidad de clientes, trabaja todos los días arduamente  y de esa forma puede tener los medios necesarios para mantener su hogar. Su meta es poder agrandar y tener un local bien equipado.
solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, esmaltes para uñas y demás insumos para su peluquería. Ella, al igual que sus compañeras está muy agradecida por la oportunidad de kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The Puertas del Futuro group is from Paraguarí city and is made up of 15 strong, hardworking women. They are all friends and neighbors. The group is currently in its thirteenth loan cycle through Fundación Paraguaya's program for women entrepreneurs. These women are working hard to improve their lives and hope to continue doing so.

Vicenta is a skilled hairstylist. She has many clients and works long hours every day to support her family. Her goal is to expand her business and to maintain a well-equipped salon. This loan will be used to buy hair dyes, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, and other beauty products. Vicenta and her group members are very grateful for the financing opportunity provided by Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy hair dye, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish and other beauty products.

loans.name: Manaf

texts.en: Manaf, a 21-year-old young man, has one brother and four sisters. They all live in the same house with their parents. Manaf is now majoring in accounting in one of the Jordanian colleges and would like to continue to get his Bachelor's degree in this major. So he applied for a loan to pay his semester’s fees in order to achieve that.

loans.use: to pay his semester’s fees

loans.name: Chati

texts.en:
Chati is 34-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in South Sudan for the past four years. 

Chati is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aparicio

texts.es:
El señor Aparicio es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 36  años, está casado con la señora Nelida. El señor Aparicio tiene su taller mecánico en la ciudad de Belén hace mas de 15 años, según el señor nos cuenta desde chico le gustaba ser mecánico y desde muy temprana edad ya se fue a trabajar como ayudante en el taller de su tío, después mas tarde cuando ya era un poco mas adulto monto su pequeño taller en casa de sus padres lo cual le fue muy bien en el negocio ya que su papa y sus hermanos también le ayudaban. Luego se caso y formo su propia familia, se independizo y traslado su taller a donde esta ahora en su local actual, y ahora esta creciendo cada día mas, tiene dos ayudantes y además su hijo el más grande ya es un gran mecánico también.
El solicita la ayuda de kiva y de fundación paraguaya para la compra de herramientas, con las cuales podrá mejorar el servicio que ofrece a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que se le está dando, pues de esa forma podrá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Aparicio is from the city of Concepción.  He is 36 years old and married to Nélida.  Aparicio has had his auto repair shop in the city of Belén for more than 15 years.

According to what he tells us, he liked being a mechanic from the time he was a little boy, and from a very young age he already had gone to work as an assistant in his uncle's shop.
