Then, later, when he was a little older he set up his small shop in his parents' house.  This business went very well for him because his father and brothers also helped him.  Later he married and started his own family.  He became independent and moved his shop to its current location.  Now he is growing more every day.  He has two assistants and also his oldest son, who also is already a great mechanic.

He is requesting help from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya to buy tools with which he will be able to improve the service he offers his customers.  He is grateful for the opportunity that is being given to him because in this way he will be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy tools to use in his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. For the past three years, she has run a food stall in South Sudan. 

Amer is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and oil. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil

loans.name: Ajok

texts.en:
Ajok is 35-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. For four years, she has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan. 

Ajok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil to sell.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en: Majeda is a 52-year-old widow who is living with her son and daughter. So she can support herself and her kids, Majeda opened a small shop selling detergents and some cosmetics a year ago. Now she is applying for a loan so she can bring in better quality detergents and improve the level of service and the products she is selling.

loans.use: to buy better quality detergents

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal, 38 years old, is a housewife who began a small business in her home yard selling detergents and clothes. Amal buys different types of detergents in large quantities in gallons and re-fills it in smaller amounts in bottles so it can be sold. Now Amal has applied for a loan to increase the amount of detergent she has and to buy more bottles so she can start distributing to closer shops.

loans.use: to buy more detergents and bottles for refilling

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer, 24 years old, is a single lady. She is known to be a cheerful young lady who likes to help others. For that reason, she got into a nursing major where she can help sick people and cheer them up a little bit. After she has graduated from the university and got her bachelors degree, she was able to start working as a nurse directly at one of the Jordanian hospitals.

But Abeer always wanted more. So she decided, while she has time now, she would continue her studies and get a higher degree. In order to achieve her dream, she has applied for this loan to register at the university and pay her semester’s fees to get a masters degree in nursing as well.

loans.use: to pay her semester’s fees

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 19-year-old single woman. She is one of four brothers and sisters who are still living with their parents.
Alaa is studying in Al Yarmouk University majoring in airport management. She has applied for a loan to pay her semester's tuition fees so she is able to finish her studies and find a job in her field.

loans.use: to pay her semester's tuition fees.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 49 years old and married, with two children aged 24 and 26. She has a laundry business to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 17 years and has employed two people. She earns extra income from her tailoring business.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to support her family financially. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy an iron box.

loans.use: to buy an iron box

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
Claudia María se ha caracterizado por ser una madre cabeza de familia perseverante y dedicada en su trabajo. Claudia María a sus 37 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 6 años y es separada de su pareja, el cual le enseño la actividad del mantenimiento de computadores. Con esta actividad aprendida, Claudia María inició un negocio de café Internet, en el que atiende todos los días de la semana y así genera los ingresos necesarios para sostener su hogar y brindarle a su hijo todo lo que necesita. Claudia María sueña con que su negocio crezca, se consolide, y sus ingresos aumenten para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo, además de ahorrar para garantizarle una buena educación en un futuro próximo.

Debido al uso constante de los computadores de su café Internet, Claudia María necesita hacerles mantenimiento para garantizar su óptimo desempeño, es por esto que necesita de un préstamo para comprar los repuestos necesarios para sus computadores.
texts.en:
Claudia María has described herself as a persevering mother and head of family who is dedicated to her job.  Claudia María, 37, has a six-year-old son and is separated from her partner, who taught her the job of computer maintenance.  Having learned this work, Claudia María started an internet café business that she operates every day of the week.  In this way she generates the necessary income to support her home and give her son everything he needs.  Claudia María dreams that her business will grow and get stronger, that her income will increase so she can give her son a better quality of life, and also that she will save to guarantee him a good education in the near future.

Owing to the constant use of the computers in her internet café, Claudia María needs to do maintenance on them to guarantee their optimum performance.  This is why she needs the loan to buy the necessary parts for her computers.

loans.use: to buy parts to do computer maintenance at her internet cafe.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya is a 27-year-old single lady who wants to help her father in his financial situation. Her father, Zidan, does metalwork from his home yard, but he doesn't have enough tools and material to grow his business. Sumaya has decided to take a loan to support her father to buy more required tools, which will help him increase his productivity.
Because Sumaya is a conservative person, she asked her father, Zidan, to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more blacksmith tools for her father.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 49 years old, married and has three children.  He has been farming for over ten years and has employed two people.  He has grown his business through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management skills.

George hopes to expand his business for more income generation in the future.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 31 years old, married and has a 2-year-old child.  He does carpentry so as to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years and has employed one person.  He also does masonry work part-time to earn extra income.

Michael hopes to expand his business and grow his clientele in the future.  He has requested a loan of 12,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 19-year-old young man who is the youngest of his brothers and sisters. He is majoring in Engineering at Al Albait University. He is planning to get a job in the engineering field after graduating so he can gain experience and then open his own engineering office.
Ahmad has applied for a loan to pay for his semester’s fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester’s fees.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: A sus 20 años, el joven Santiago es un emprendedor quien decide junto con un amigo iniciar su propio negocio y poner en marcha la venta al por mayor de artículos como gorras, gafas y relojes por Internet distribuyendo sus productos a través de un ambiente Web a todas las regiones del país. Con la esperanza de mejorar sus ventas y realizar además estas al por menor, el joven Santiago necesita de la compra de mercancía en gorras, gafas y relojes con lo cual puede cumplir su objetivo. A corto plazo, sueña con tener un gran número de clientes y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres.
texts.en:
Santiago, age 20, is a young entrepreneur who decided to start an internet business with his friend. They sell items wholesale, including baseball caps, sunglasses and watches. They distribute products to all regions in the country. 

In hopes of improving sales and pursuing retail distribution, Santiago is applying for a loan to buy additional merchandise. Santiago's short-term goals are to increase his customer base and to provide a better quality of life to his parents.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as baseball hats, sunglasses, and watches.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is 42 years old and a mother of three.  She weaves baskets using nylon and sisal.  She has been in the business for three years.  She also does poultry farming to earn more income.  Previously, she used to run a grocery.

Milkah hopes to grow her business for more income generation in the future. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy raw materials such as nylon and sisal.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as nylon and sisal

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 16  integrantes de la ciudad de Encarnación, son clientes desde julio del año pasado con excelente conducta de pago. El comité  tiene mucha experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que trabajan desde hace  mucho  tiempo, se reúnen cada semana para resolver  las cuestiones del día a día.
Una de las integrantes, Ramona, tiene 31 años,  tiene 2  hijos, está acompañada con el señor Cesar quien trabaja  de empleado en una empresa. La Sra. Ramona  se dedica a la venta de ropas de toda temporada, en lo que comenta que le va muy bien, pues siempre tiene muy buenos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Su meta es poder seguir ayudando a su familia y a su marido.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de camisas, camisillas, pantalones, camisillas y demás tipo de prendas, para que de esa forma tenga más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 16 members from Encarnación city. They have been clients since July of last year and have maintained an excellent payment history. The group is experienced and has worked well together as a group for some time. The members meet weekly to address any questions that arise.

One of the members, Ramona, is 31 years old and has two children. Her husband Cesar is employed in a private company. Ramona sells clothing for all seasons. Her sales are strong since she always has good products to offer to her customers. Her goal is to continue helping her husband support their family.

Ramona is requesting a loan to buy shirts, undershirts and pants, among other clothing products, in order to increase the variety of clothing she can offer to her customers.

loans.use: To buy shirts, undershirts, pants, and other types of clothing to sell retail.

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es: Dora Isabel ha trabajado fuertemente para sacar adelante su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos y su esposo. Dora Isabel tiene su fuente de ingresos gracias a la venta de mercancía, actividad que lo hace esporádicamente y a la confección, que esta actividad es la que mayores ingresos le deja y la que mayor proyección augura. Dora Isabel aprendió la actividad de la confección gracias a su madre y a una hermana, y es con esta hermana con quién trabaja desde hace algún tiempo la confección a terceros. Dora Isabel afirma que la mejor temporada es la de principio de año ya que le asignan un mayor número de contratos en la confección de uniformes, y por esto debe aprovechar esta temporada. Dora Isabel quiere ofrecer mayores servicios a sus clientes, por lo que busca por medio de un préstamo la compra de una máquina plana. Espera que así se aumenten sus contratos y con ello sus ingresos, y poder así cumplir el sueño de expandir su negocio y empezar a confeccionar su línea propia. Dora Isabel aspira a dejarle a sus dos hijos una taller de confección posicionado que les permita tener una estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Dora Isabel is married with two children and has worked hard to get her family ahead.   She has two sources of income: selling merchandise, an activity she does sporadically, and tailoring.  The latter activity is the one that allows her to earn higher income and predict higher sales.  Dora Isabel learned tailoring from her mother and sister. She has worked with this sister for some time tailoring for third parties.  She states that the best season is the beginning of the year as they assign her a greater number of uniforms to make and she takes advantage of this season.  She wants to offer better services to her customers, so she is looking for a loan to buy a flat sewing machine.  She hopes to increase her contracts and therefore, her income so that she can fulfill her dream of expanding her business and making her own line of clothing.  Dora Isabel aspires to leave her two children a tailoring workshop positioned to allow them to have economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase a flat sewing machine for her tailoring workshop.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 20-year-old young man. He is one of six brothers and sisters who live together with their parents.
Mahmoud is a student in one of the Jordanian universities. He is majoring in chemical manufacturing technologies, and he is still in his freshman year. Now Mahmoud has applied for a loan to pay his semester's fees and continue his studies.

loans.use: pay his semester's fees.

loans.name: Jentrix

texts.en:
Jentrix is married and with two children.  She sells fish so as to earn a living.  She has employed two people in her business.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business because she has been trained in business management skills.

Jentrix hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Amelia

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 66 años, es muy trabajadora y muy responsable en las actividades que realiza. Carmen es soltera y vive con su único hijo en Pelileo que se encuentra a 20 minutos de Ambato en la Provincia de Tungurahua.

Carmen trabaja con su hijo en el cultivo de tomates, ya que este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos que tienen para poder sustentar los gastos de su hogar. Ya son casi 7 años que trabaja con Fodemi, el actual crédito que solicita es para la compra de abonos, fungicidas debido a que por el mal clima los cultivos pueden dañarse y con esta inversión ayudará a que los tomates esten en buenas condiciones y sean de buena calidad y puedan venderse en el mercado. carmen con esta inversión obtendrá buenas ventas e ingresos que ayudarán a sustentar los gastos de su hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Carmen sueña en comprar otro terreno para poder sembrar más y poder ser una microdistribuidora.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 66-year-old woman who is hardworking and very responsible in the work she does.  Carmen is single and lives with her only child in Pelileo, which is 20 minutes from Ambato in the province of Tungurahua.

Carmen works with her son growing tomatoes because this business is the only source of income they have to be able to pay their household expenses.  She has been working with FODEMI for almost seven years.  The current loan she is requesting is to buy fertilizer and fungicide because of the bad climate that can harm the crops.  This investment will help the tomatoes be in good condition and of good quality, so they can be sold in the market.  With this investment Carmen will get good sales and income, which will help her pay for her household expenses and improve her quality of life.

Carmen dreams about buying another plot of land to be able to plant more and be able to be a micro-distributor.

loans.use: to buy fungicide and fertilizer because the bad climate can damage the crops and cause loss.

loans.name: Majdiya

texts.en: Majdiya is 23 years old and one of nine brothers and sisters. She is a student at a Jordanian college. Majdiya would like to have the opportunity to finish her studies and graduate so she can contribute to the family's income by having a job in the field in which she is majoring. In order to do so, Majdiya has applied for a loan to pay her semester's fees.

loans.use: pay her semester's fees.

loans.name: Christine Akinyi

texts.en:
Christine Akinyi is a 33-year-old clothes seller in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of three. She has been selling clothes for the past three years, and she is doing great.

This is Christine’s second loan from KADET. She plans to purchase bales of shirts, T-shirts, blouses, and skirts to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to excel in the clothes selling business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of shirts, T-shirts, blouses, and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel used his previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more trousers. Since then, he has gained more profits from his business. Daniel is looking forward to expanding his business into wholesale within five years. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy more trousers.

loans.use: to buy more trousers for resale.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
El socio Hipolito se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pescados y mariscos,el socio vende en un mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los pescados y mariscos.El socio colicita el creditoa para comprar pescados y mariscos al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Hipolito continues selling fish and seafood, which he sells at a market from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  This work helps him to get his family ahead.  His dream is to have a local where he can sell his fish and seafood.  He is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale fish and seafood.  He is happy to receive the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fish and seafood.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 19-year-old young man. He is the youngest of his four brothers and one sister. He recently finished high school and successfully applied to one of the Jordanian universities. He is now in his freshman year majoring in accounting.
Ashraf is hoping that when he graduates and gets his bachelors degree he will be able to continue studying to get higher certifications and a masters degree in accounting. He has applied for a loan to pay his semester's fees.

loans.use: pay his semester's fees.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pescados,ella vende todo tipo de pescados,ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pescados.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pescado al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member, Graciela, continues to sell fish.  She sells all kinds of fish and works from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm.  Her dream is to have a local where she can sell fish.  She is requesting the loan to buy wholesale fish.  She is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase wholesale fish.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 28 years old, married, and blessed with a two-year-old child. To earn a living, she runs a salon. She has been in the business for ten years and has employed one person. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. Lucy hopes to open a big salon in the future. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shampoo.

loans.use: To buy shampoo for her salon.

loans.name: Rafaela Emilia

texts.es: Rafaela es una emprendedora que se le ha brindado apoyo con el financiamiento para invertir en el negocio del destace de cerdos en el cual ella nos expresa que con el financiamiento  ha aumentado sus ventas y sus clientes que la visitan que son fijos y eventuales. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir en la  negocio en la compra de  cerdos y poder cumplir  con los pedidos que tiene  de sus cliente de la carne de cerdo.
texts.en: Rafaela is an enterprising woman who has been provided with funding support to invest in the business of butchering pigs.  She tells us that, with the funding, sales have increased and so has the number of regular and occasional customers who visit her.  At this time, she is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of pigs for her business.  This will enable her to fill the existing orders from customers for pork.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comestibles como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite y golosinas,ella vende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member still is in the business of selling food items such as rice, sugar, milk, oil and sweets.  Her business hours are from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. and, through her work, she is able to provide for her children.  She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil, wholesale.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk and oil, wholesale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Maribel; La socia continua con sus actividades diarias en el trabajo, la socia en esta ocasión desea adquirir muebles y para ello invertira su credito en la compra de muebles para la sala. La socia desea pagar al contado sus muebles e ir pagando de pocos con sus sueldo al banco comunal en el que pertenece.
texts.en: The member is Mrs. Maribel who still works at her job.  On this occasion she wants to use the loan to buy furniture for her living room.  She plans to pay cash for the furniture and use her salary to pay back the loan to the communal bank she belongs to.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her living room.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is 31 years old; she is married and has a 6-year-old child.  She sells second-hand shoes to earn a living.  She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business.

Racheal's desire is to expand her business in order to generate more income for her family.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos.El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para su carro.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member still has his transportation business and provides taxi service in the different streets of the city of Cusco.  He works from 5:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and through his work has been able to provide for his children.  He is requesting a loan to buy tires for his vehicle.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Trabajadoras ” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de Union. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  pero también hacen actividades para fomentar su compañerismo. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Ursulina, quien cuenta que tiene una librería bien surtida, gracias a la cual ella puede trabajar y obtener los medios para poder sostener a su familia. Ella comenta que siempre tiene buena venta, ya que en todo momento del año hay gente comprando algo y eso la ayuda a tener buenas ganancias. Su proposito es seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cuadernos, libros, lapices, pinceles y demás insumos con los cuales podrá abastecerse y tener un buen stock para cuando las clases vuelvan a iniciar.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Trabajadoras" was formed by several neighbors of the community called Union.  All of the members are involved in independent businesses, but they also get together for activities that foster team spirit.  They are very hard-working, determined women.

One of the members is Mrs. Ursulina who has a well-stocked bookstore that allows her to work and make enough income to support her family.  She says sales are always good because throughout the year people are always buying something, and that generates good profits.  Her goal is to keeping growing and continue helping her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy notebooks, books, pencils, brushes and other supplies to restock her store for when school begins.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, books, pencils, brushes and other supplies.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de repuestos de máquina, tipo soldaduras y suministros electricos la socia desea ene sta ocasión invertir el prestamo en la compra de soldaduras y de suministros electricos para vender a sus clientes los mecanicos, a personas que venden maquinarias como molineros. La socia desea seguri prosperando para terminar de construir su vivienda y educar a sus hijos y crecer economicamente. La socia desea invertir en la compra de maquinarias como soldadoras, suministros varios para vender.
texts.en:
The member is Mrs. Felicitas who continues with her business selling spare parts for machinery, such as welding tools, and electric supplies.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy welding tools and electric supplies to sell to her mechanical customers, and people who sell food mill machines.  She wants to continue earning a good income to finish building her house, giver her children an education and grow economically.  

She plans to buy welding tood and other supplies to sell.

loans.use: To buy welding tools and other supplies to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. To earn a living, he runs a motorbike transport business. He also sells charcoal to generate additional income.  He has managed to grow his business through financial support from Faulu Kenya.  

Victor hopes to grow his business in the future and to become more financially stable.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to add to his stock of charcoal.

loans.use: to add to his stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el realiza servicio de taxi desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante y poder estudira alguna carrera profesional,el sueño del socio es comprar otro carro nuevo.El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar respuestos para su carro como autopartes.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues working in transportation; he provides taxi services from 5am until 8pm.  Through this business he wants to get ahead and to be able to study a professional career.  His dream is to buy another new car.  He’s asking for the loan to buy spare parts for his car.  He‘s happy about the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Ongeri

texts.en:
Ongeri is 39 years old and married with six children. He farms to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years and has employed 2 people. He has improved his business since he joined Faulu Kenya, thanks to Faulu Kenya for training him in business management skills.  

His desire is to run a large-scale farm in the future. Ongeri has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Juntos Para El Exito Group

texts.es: Un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, trabajadoras y unidas, así está conformada  el grupo  "Juntos para el Exito" , integrada por 7 personas,  sobresalen grandes mujeres, cada una con una historia en particular una de ellas es la señora Mónica de 25 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos pequeños,  desde pequeña vivió rodeada de ejemplos y coraje que la animaron a emprender el negocio de Venta de ropa  ya con 5 años en el negocio a podido dar lo mejor a sus 3  hijos como educacion y alimentacion, ya que comenzó a vender a la gente de su barrio y ahora tiene clientes fijos, en los tiempos libres también lava ropa, con grandes sueños y metas por cumplir, en el fututo piensa poner un local para la venta de ropa y con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en comprar  más mercadería y poder tener lo necesario para salir adelante por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
A group of enterprising, hardworking and united women formed the “Juntos para el Exito” group.  It has seven outstanding women as members, each with her own particular story.

One of them is Mónica, 25.  She has a spouse and three little children.  Since childhood she lived surrounded by examples of courage that motivated her to start a business selling clothes and now, with five years’ experience in the business, she’s been able to give the best to her three children like education and food.  

She started out selling to locals in her neighborhood and now she has regular customers.  In her free time she also takes in laundry.  

She has great dreams and goals to reach.  In the future, she plans to open a clothing store and will use the latest loan to buy more merchandise so that she can have everything necessary to get ahead for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Iris Suyapa

texts.es:
Iris Suyapa, tiene 39 años de edad, casada desde hace 15 años, vive en Cofradia, Cortes, su esposo se dedica también al comercio.
La señora Iris, se dedica a vender mercadería, como joyas, toallas, cortinas, manteles, sabanas y almohadas. Este negocio lo inicio con fondos propios, desde hace seis años, le ofrecía productos a  sus vecinas y fue incrementando su inventario según encargos o pedidos. 
Sale a ofrecer mercadería los fines de semana, la mayor parte de ventas la realiza de acuerdo a pedidos. 
Para mantener productos en existencia y satisfacer al cliente  a invertido cuatro prestamos. Con este préstamo actual va comprar juego de ropa de cama, cortinas, tollas y joyas. 
Con las ganancias que obtenga va comprar artículos de novedades y un mostrador de productos, para ampliar más en negocio.
texts.en:
Iris Suyapa, 39, has been married for 15 years and lives in Cofradía, Cortes; her husband is also a merchant.

Iris sells merchandise like jewelry, towels, curtains, tablecloths, sheets and pillows.  She started the business with funds of her own six years go.  She sells products to her neighbors and has gradually increased her inventory according to requests and orders placed.  She sells on weekends and most of her sales are based on prior orders.

To keep merchandise in stock and meet customer demand he has invested four loans.  She will use this present one to buy sets of bed linens, curtains, towels and jewelry.  With profits obtained she will buy novelty items and a display case to expand her business more.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,ella sigue alquilando un taxi y su esposo lo maneja,la socia ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de productos como galletas y champanes,ella vende en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender galletas y champanes.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar galletas y champanes al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues working in transportation leasing a taxi that her husband drives.  She’s also now selling products like cookies and champagne independently from 8am until 7pm.  Through these businesses she’s able to support her children.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the cookies and champagne.  She’s asking for a loan to buy cookies and champagne at wholesale.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy cookies and champagne at wholesale.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "QORIMANKACHA"; Este banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y en el departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luciana; la socia tiene 60 años de edad; la socia es casada y tiene ya a sus hijos independientes, la socia tiene su tienda de venta de productos de bazar y regalos la socia vende peluches, adornos, joyas, perfumes, cremas, papel de regalo, floreros, cuadernos, lapiceros, tarjetas entre muchos mas articulos de bazar y regalos, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir en la compra de nuevos productos e implementar su tienda. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de articulos de bazar y de regalos.
La socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Luciana, 60, belongs to the “Qorimankacha” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.  She’s married and her children are all independent now.

She has a store where she sells gift items and general merchandise.  She sells stuffed toys, decorations, jewelry, perfume, creams, gift wrapping paper, vases, notebooks, mechanical pencils, greeting cards among many other gift items and general merchandise.

On this occasion she wants to buy new products to stock her store.  She’s asking for the loan to buy gift items and general merchandise.  She commits to make her installment payments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: to buy gift items and general merchandise.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 30 years old and married with three children. To earn a living, she practices farming.  She has been farming for 12 years, and she has employed four people in her business. Previously, she operated a salon. She has gained a lot of business management skills through the seminars held by Faulu Kenya.

Her desire is to grow her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es:
La señora Paulina nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (En la fotografía la señora Paulina se encuentra vestida con pantalón color guinda, con saco de color plomo y chalina de color azul). Paulina  tiene 65 años edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Paulina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y aparte de ser ama de casa también se dedica a diferentes actividades económicas como por ejemplo brindar servicio de fotocopiadora, alquilar de habitaciones y venta de cosméticos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a los negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Paulina requiere el préstamo para comprar más cosméticos. 

El banco comunal “Virgen de Copacabana” está conformado por 12 personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Paulina was born in the city of Cusco and still lives there.  (In the photo, Paulina is wearing purple pants, dark gray coat and blue scarf).   Paulina is 65 years old, married and has three children.

Paulina is an enterprising, hardworking woman who supports her family.  Besides being a housewife she also carries out a variety of economic activities.  For example, she provides photocopying services, she leases rooms and she sells cosmetics.  She’s been in business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  On this occasion, Paulina needs the loan to buy more cosmetics.

The “Virgen de Copacabana” communal bank has 12 responsible, hardworking members who support their families.  Most of the members live in the city of Cusco where they carry out their economic activities.  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located there.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Esperanza” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de una de las comunidades de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas ellas tienen  sus propias actividades, pero también realizan actividades en grupo, para que de esa forma puedan fomentar su compañerismo.
Nilda es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella al igual que la mayoría de sus compañeras se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como ser cerdos y pollos. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado y trabajoso, ya que debe de estar pendiente las 24 hs de sus animales, para que estos estén bien. Su meta es tener una gran granja para poder tener un mayor número de animales.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de lechones y pollitos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir creciendo. Además de eso desea poder comprar alimentos para sus animales. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por esta oportunidad de progreso que estas le dan.
texts.en:
The “La Esperanza” (Hope) arose when several neighbors from one of the communities in the city of Santaní joined together.  All of them have their own activities but they also carry out group activities to strengthen their companionship.

Nilda is one of the group members.  Like most of her fellow group members she raises animals like pigs and chickens to sell.   She comments that her work is very demanding and hard because she must be watchful 24 hours a day so that her animals will be well.  Her goal is to have a big farm in order to have a larger amount of animals.

She is asking for the loan to buy piglets and chicks so that she can continue growing.  She also wants to buy feed for her animals.  She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity to progress they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy piglets and chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Antonieta; La socia continua con su negocio de fotocopiadora, la socia desea aumentar los suministros de sus negocio como comprar papeles para las impresiones, comprar tinta para las fotocopias, la socia invertira el prestamo en la compra de estos suministros para implementar sus negocio.
texts.en:
Antonieta continues with her photocopying business.  She wishes to get more business supplies.  She wants to buy things like printing paper and ink for the photocopies.  

She will use the loan to buy these supplies in order to fully implement her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to fully implement her business.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,ella alquila un taxi y lo hace trabajar en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,la socia tambien esta vendiendo productos como panetones,champanes y vinos,ella vende en forma independiente,por medio de este negocio la socia puede salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda los productos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar panetones,champanes y vinos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in the transportation business.  She rents out a taxi to work in different streets in the city of Cusco.  She also is selling products such as panettone, Champagne, and wine.  She sells independently.  With this business the member is able to get ahead.  Her dream is to have a place to sell the products.

She is requesting the loan to buy panettone, Champagne, and wine wholesale.

The member is happy about the loan and is committed to making her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy panettone, Champagne, and wine wholesale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; La socia continua con sus actividades diarias en su trabajo de fisoterapeutica, ella tiene su propio consultorio y también continua con la venta de seguros de vida y en esta ocasión la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de muebles para implementar y mejorar su consultorio.
texts.en: The member, Elizabeth, continues her daily work as a physical therapist.  She has her own consulting room and also continues to sell life insurance.  At this time, she wishes to invest the loan in the purchase of furniture to implement and improve her consulting room.

loans.use: to purchase furniture to implement and improve her consulting room.

loans.name: Maria Encarnacion

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de carne,ella vende carne de cerdo,de res y de oveja,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,ella tiene un puesto en el mercado y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de carne.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is still dedicated to selling meat. She sells pork, beef, and sheep meat. She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. She has a merchant stand in the market and by means of this business, she advances her children. Her dream is to expand her business of selling meat. She requests the loan to buy shoes wholesale. 
She is happy about the loan, and she agrees to comply with the payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Marina;  La socia continua con su negocio de atención y administracion de su restaurante, la socia desea seguir prosperando y para ello se esfuerza todos los dias para crecer economicamnete y dar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos, la socia desea en esta ocasión invertir el prestamo en la compra de insumos para la cocina, la socia comprara arros, aceite, otros insumos al por mayor.
texts.en: The member is Marina; She continues with her business of personal care and administration of her restaurant. She wishes to continue to prosper and for that she strives everyday to grow economically and give a good quality of life to her children. On this occasion, she wishes to invest her loan in the purchase of supplies for the kitchen. She will buy rice, oil, and other supplies wholesale.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and other supplies wholesale.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Kuña Aty es el grupo formado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní. Ellas son mujeres de escasos recursos que se unieron con el propósito de salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto y de esa forma poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas son mujeres muy emprendedoras y por sobre todo sacrificadas y trabajadoras. Tienen como objetivo principal, ayudar a sus hijos y familiares a salir adelante.
Celia es una de las integrantes de este grupo, tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida, con la cual abastece a su barrio, ella gracias a sus buenos precios y a su buena atención ha podido ya formarse una buena clientela y de esa forma obtener los ingresos que necesita para el día a día. Nos cuenta que su inspiración para seguir luchando es su familia, ya que quiere darles un mejor estilo de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, lácteos, verduras, lácteos, y demás productos de primera necesidad, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y poder ofrecer mejores productos a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Kuña Aty is the group comprised of ten women in the city of Santani. They are poor women who joined forces in order to come out ahead by working together and in that way be able to help each other. They are very enterprising women and above all self-sacrificing and hard working. Their main objective is to help their children and families come out ahead.
Celia is one of the members of this group. She has a well-stocked store with which she caters to her neighborhood. Thanks to her good prices and good attention she has been able to form a good clientele and in that way obtain the income necessary for the day to day. She tells us that her inspiration to keep fighting is her family, since she wants to give them a better lifestyle.
She requests the loan to buy meats, dairy, vegetables, and other staple products with which she will be able to stock up and offer her customers better products. She thanks the foundation and Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy meat, dairy, vegetables, and other staple products.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona tiene 48 años, convive con Efraín de 32 años y tienen 05. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en la comunidad de Camunachari. Simona, es campesina  sus padres le enseñaron éste oficio desde muy niña, desde entonces ha ejercido esta actividad durante 20 años, cultivando y criando animales. En tiempos de festividades, los animales que posee como gallinas, cerdos, son vendidos rápidamente, pues la crianza y alimentación que les da, supera a la competencia y por ello tiene buenas ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es comprar sus animales desde muy pequeños y luego verlas grandes y robustos con el tiempo. Considera que lo más difícil es cuando las enfermedades que ocasionan a los animales puede ser muy riesgoso para los demás. En adelante, espera comprar nuevos animales, para aumentar su producción. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará nuevos animales, para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Simona is 48 years old and lives with Efraín, who is 32 years old.  They live, together with their five children, in their own home in the community of Camunachari.  Simona is a farmer, whose parents taught her this trade when she was a very young girl.  She has been farming and raising animals for 20 years since then.  In times of the festivities, she has hens and pigs that sell quickly, due to the good breeding and diet that she provides them.  She surpasses the competition and, for this reason, she has good profits.  What she likes most about her job is buying her animals when they are very young and then watching them grow large and robust with time.  What she considers the most difficult is when the animals contract diseases as this may place the others at risk.  In the future, she hopes to buy new animals in order to increase production.  This will be her second loan with MFP; she feels that the money from the loan will help a lot with the progress of her business.  She is very dear to the rest of her companions in the communal bank and shares a bond of solidarity with them. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, she will purchase new animals in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more animals such as hens and pigs.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemi de  44 de años de edad labora como docente de secundaria  desde hace 9 años, está solicitando su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en arreglo de un cuarto de su casa de habitación que se le esta deteriorando una pared, en su barrio hay buenas referencias de ella que es una persona trabajadora, responsable,  quien ha demostrado espíritu de superación, por medio de sus estudios y  y trabajo luchando cada día por salir adelante, su compañero de vida tambien se desempeña como docente ambos comparten con los gastos familiares, Su mayor sueño en la es gozar de mejores condiciones, tener trabajo, salud y sobre todo estar bien con Dios.
texts.en: Noemi, 44 years old, has worked as a secondary-school teacher for 9 years. She is asking for her seventh loan to fix a room in the house where she lives, which has a wall that is falling apart. She has good references from her neighborhood; she is a hard-working, responsible person who has demonstrated the spirit to overcome through her studies and her work fighting every day to move forward. Her life partner is also a teacher. They share family expenses. Her greatest dream is to enjoy better conditions, have work and health, and above all to be right with God.

loans.use: to plaster the walls of her house

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana, de 22 años de edad,  convive con Noe de 24 años y tienen un hijo en su haber;  Jampier  de 07 años de edad. Juntos habitan en su propia casa. Yovana, trata de luchar contra las adversidades del destino y olvidar la inestabilidad familiar que aqueja su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer con carácter y muy competitiva en el negocio, a pesar de que tuvo percances en el camino, supo sobresalir del mal momento. Desde hace 08 años trabaja de forma independiente, tiene un puesto donde vende ropa para todo el público en general. En efecto reconoce que lo esta beneficiando de forma positiva, ya que sus ventas aumentaron con el transcurrir del tiempo. La clave de su éxito, radica en la calidad y el precio de su producto. Con el tiempo piensa alquilar un espacio en las galerías para poder vender con mayor rapidez y así exponer toda la variedad de ropa hacia el publico, según lo gustos y preferencias. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, espera una vez mas ser apoyada con el financiamiento para seguir surgiendo. En su banco comunal es una socia colaboradora y muy querida  por el resto de sus compañeros. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles; comprará  mayor cantidad de ropa por lo cual tiene que viajar a la ciudad de lima para adquirir más ropa a precio módico.
texts.en: Yovana is 22 years old and lives with Noe, who is 24 years old.  They live together in their own home with their seven year old son, Jampier.  Yovana tries to struggle against fate’s adversities and forget the family instability that afflicts her home.  She is a woman of character and is very competitive in business.  In spite of having had mishaps on the way, she knew how to rise above the bad times.  For the past eight years, she has worked independently; she has a stall where she sells clothing for the general public.  In fact, she recognizes that this is a positive benefit, since her sales have increased with the passage of time.  The key to her success lies in the quality and price of her products.  In time, she thinks that she will rent a space in the shopping galleries in order to make sales more quickly and display her wide variety of clothing to the public in a way that appeals to their tastes and preferences.  This will be her first loan with MFP; she hopes to receive the funding support once again to continue rising above adversity.  In her communal bank, she is a collaborator and is beloved by the rest of her companions.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles, she will purchase a higher quantity of clothing and, in order to acquire it at a modest price, she will have to travel to Lima.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Beatriz Maria

texts.es: Beatriz de 34 años, habitante de la zona Urbana de Nueva Guinea,labora como docente de primaria en la comarca en Torno,  solicita su 3er crédito para Invertirlo en gastos de titulacion y de esta manera obtener su titulo de licenciada en ciencias de la educacion, su esposo trabaja en la pequeña finca que ellos poseen se dedica a la siembra de raices y tuberculos y la agricultura de granos basicos ambos se ayudan con los gastos,  en su comunidad es una persona con buenas referencias, al igual que en su trabajo.   Su sueño ser una licenciada con mucha experiencia y impartir clases de secundaria y ayudar a su familia ya que son personas bien humildes y de escasos economicos.
texts.en: Beatriz, 34 years old, lives in the urban area of Nueva Guinea. She works as a primary school teacher in the surrounding rural area. She is asking for her third loan for degree expenses so she can obtain her college degree in education science. Her husband works on the small farm they own; he grows roots and tubers and basic grains. Both of them help with expenses. She has good references in her community and in her work. Her dream is to be a graduate with a lot of experience and teach secondary school classes and help her family, since they are pretty humble people with scarce economic resources.

loans.use: to pay for a degree course.

loans.name: Blanca Judith

texts.es: Blanca Judith de 32 años de edad,labora como docente de primaria desde hace 6 años. Solicita su crédito para hecharle la ceramica a su   casa, y de esta manera brindarle mejores condiciones a su familia, es importante mencionar que en sus horas libres se dedica a vender productos botanicos en los que obtiene ingresos para el sosten familiar.  Su sueño es seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda y que su familia goze de salu y trabajo.
texts.en: Blanca Judith, 32, has been working as a primary school teacher for the past 6 years.  She is requesting a loan in order to install tile on her house and in this way provide her family with better living conditions. It is important to mention that in her free time she sells botanical products in order to earn more family income. Her dream is to continue improving her home’s infrastructure and that her family enjoys good health and jobs.

loans.use: to install tile.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel de 54 años es un hombre separado. Tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 15 años. Él vive con Andrea, su hija mayor, mientras que la otra está bajo la custodia de su madre. Abel y su hija viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Abel es un hombre de negocios, sabe como comercializar su producción. Agricultor desde niño, aprendió como obtener ingresos inmediatamente. 
En sus 2 parcelas de terrenos siembra café, plátanos y yuca. Tiene que ser así para abastecerse con los ingresos en los diferentes meses del año.
“De mis chacras saco 1500 kilos de café”, menciona. Abel negocia sus productos al por mayor. Vende cada kilo de café en bruto a 1 sol y 40 céntimos, así asegura su venta inmediata.
Ahora esta pensando ampliar su producción, para eso invertirá en la compra de viveros de café y abonos orgánicos. Con la ayuda de su hija, quien se encarga de preparar los alimentos para los jornaleros que trabajan su tierra puede lograr sus metas. Sería la primera vez que Abel recibiría un préstamo de MFP, muestra compromiso y seguridad para pagar las cuotas de los pagos. Confía que, trabajando en grupo sus resultados serán mayores, por eso pertenece al banco comunal “Los productores Yaneshas”.
Invertirá el dinero en el pago de los jornaleros que trabajarán en el cultivo de las plantas de café. Invierte de 25 a 30 soles por día, incluyendo alimentación.
texts.en:
Abel, 54, is separated.  He has two daughters, 17 and 15. He lives with his older daughter, Andrea, while his younger daughter is in her mother’s custody. Abel and his daughter live in their own home in the indigenous community of Villa María in Chanchamayo Province. 

Abel is a businessman. He knows how to market his products. A farmer since he was a child, he learned how to earn an immediate income.  He plants coffee, plantains and manioc on his two parcels of land. He must do this in order to insure a steady stream of income throughout the year. He notes that “I harvest 1,500 kilos of coffee from my fields.”  He sells his crops wholesale. He sells raw coffee beans at 1 sol 40 céntimos per kilo, thus insuring an immediate sale. 

He is now thinking of expanding his production. Consequently he will invest in the purchase of coffee nurseries and organic fertilizer. With the help of his daughter, who is in charge of preparing food for the day laborers who work the land, he can meet his goals. This will be Abel’s first loan from MFP. He shows the commitment and reliability to make his payments on time. He confides that his results will be better by working in a group and for this reason he belongs to the “Los Productores Yaneshas” Communal Bank. He will invest his loan in paying the day laborers who will cultivate his coffee plants. He pays them 25 to 30 soles a day, including food.

loans.use: to contract day laborers..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by buying two tanks of gas and a cart with a gas cooker to prepare grilled meat.

loans.name: Maribel De Jesus

texts.es:
La  joven Maribel de Jesus de 32 años de edad, labora en docente, su esposo con su trabajo le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ambos son muy responsables, reconocido en el municipio de buen vivir, profesan la religion catolica, son bien abnegados a su trabajo y le gusta compartir con el que lo necesita siempre y cuando tengan.  

Está solicitando su crédito para hecharle la ceramica a su vivienda y repello de la cocina  y asi tener mejores condiciones.  Su sueño es que familia goze de salud, amor y sobre todo que tengan un trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maribel de Jesus is a 32 year old young woman.  She works in education.  Her husband works to help her with the household expenses.  Both of them are very responsible and are known in their town for their good living.  They are Catholic, dedicated to their jobs and always like to share with those in need if they can.  

She is requesting loan to install ceramic tile in her home and plaster her kitchen to improve her living conditions.  Her dream is for her family to enjoy good health, love and above all, to have a decent job.

loans.use: to install ceramic tile and plaster her kitchen.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia de 43 años, es una mujer soltera. Tiene 3 hijos, los 2 mayores se encuentran en la ciudad de Lima, y sólo vive con el menor de 13 años en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Celia es una mujer y madre ejemplar. Se dedica a la agricultura, en sus 3 parcelas de terrenos agrícolas. Ahí cultiva café y plátanos, cuyos frutos los comercializa en la ciudad de Pichanaki. Este trabajo es muy cansado para ella sola, es por eso que contrata los servicios de jornaleros para la limpieza y poseo (acumulación de tierras alrededor de las plantas).
También elabora viveros de café, en esa actividad invierte en la compra de abonos y en el embolsado. Su venta es igual de rentable que la venta misma de los granos de café.
A la vez, Celia es profesora de educación primaria. Todas las mañanas se dirige a su centro de trabajo con el carisma y la dedicación que la caracteriza. 
Todo su esfuerzo es por la superación de ella y sus hijos. Viaja constantemente para visitarlos y atenderlos. Se siente orgullosa de ellos, por que cada quien tiene sus metas fijas, y para ella es lo más gratificante en todos estos años de trabajo. Sería la primera vez que Celia recibiría un préstamo de MFP, por eso muestra firmeza al mencionar que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los productores Yaneshas”, es su reciente banco comunal, siente que en grupo sus logros serán mayores.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de bolsas de abonos, en el pago de los jornaleros para limpiar sus tierras y para el embolsado de sus viveros.
texts.en:
Celia, 43, is a single woman.  She has three children.  The two older ones live in the city of Lima, and she only lives with the youngest, who is 13, in her own house in the native community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki in the province of Chanchamayo.  Celia is an exemplary woman and mother.  

She works as a farmer on her three parcels of agricultural land where she grows coffee and bananas.  She sells her crops in the city of Pichanaki.  The work is very tiring for her alone, so she hires laborers to clean her fields and poseo (accumulating dirt around the plants).  She also has a coffee seedling nursery, so for this activity she will invest in the purchase of bags of fertilizer.  Their sale is as profitable as selling coffee beans.

Celia is also a primary school teacher.  Every morning, she goes to work with her characteristic charisma and dedication.  All of her effort is so that she and her children can get ahead.  She constantly travels to visit them and take care of them.  She feels proud of them because each one has their goals set, and that is the most gratifying thing about her many years of work.  

This will be Celia's first loan with MFP, so she wants to mention that she will be on time with all of her payments.  "Los Productores Yaneshas" is her recent community bank and she thinks that with a group, her achievements will be greater.

She will use her loan to purchase bags of fertilizer, to pay laborers to clean her fields, and to bag her seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire laborers.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra de 32 años de edad, trabaja como docente del Colegio Rubén Dario desde hace 11 años, solicita su  crédito para  invertirlo en remodelación de una habitación en su casa y pintarla, en su comunidad es muy reconocida como una persona honesta y responsable en sus compromisos, su esposo la ayuda con los gastos del hogar ya que ambos son asalariados y bien unidos.  Su sueño es tener una casa mas grande con mejores condiciones como toda persona lo desea, que su familia goze de salud y trabaja para que no falte lo basico en el hogar.
texts.en: Sandra, 32 years old, has worked as a teacher at Colegio Rubén Dario for 11 years. She is asking for a loan to remodel a room in her house and paint it. She is very well-known in her community as an honest person who is responsible regarding her commitments. Her husband helps her with household expenses, since they are both salaried and are pretty united. Her dream is to have a bigger house with better conditions, like everyone wants, and for her family to enjoy good health. She works so that her household does not lack the basics.

loans.use: to remodel a room

loans.name: Jimy

texts.es: Jimy de 23 es un hombre soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres con sus hermanos en la comunidad nativa Villa María en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Jimy es un joven emprendedor. Desde los 17 años empezó con las actividades del campo, y a sus 23 años ya tiene experiencia en el cultivo de café y plátanos así como en el negocio de sus productos. Cuenta con 2 parcelas de terrenos, en la mayor parte tiene cultivadas plantas de café, y sólo media parcela de plátanos.  Los plátanos los cosecha cada quince días, obteniendo ingresos 2 veces al mes. En cambio el café requiere de más cuidados, pero su cosecha anual es más que gratificante. “Cada año aumenta mi producción, la última  vez coseché 8 sacos de café”, menciona orgulloso. Jimy sabe que es lo que le conviene, por eso seguirá trabajando en la tierra con la siembra de más cultivos de café y variar sus productos. Tener hijos y esposa no está en sus prioridades, crecer como persona es su principal preocupación. Éste sería su primer préstamo que obtendría gracias a su ayuda de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Acaba de formar parte del banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”, del que se siente emocionado por el trabajo en grupos. Jimy, de recibir el dinero podrá iniciar una siembra de plátanos, comprando pequeños plantas de plátanos y bolsas de abono orgánicos para asegurar su sano crecimiento.
texts.en:
Jimy is an unmarried, 23 year old man.  He lives with his parents and his brothers in the native community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki in the province of Chanchamayo.  Jimy is a young entrepreneur.  He began working in the fields at 17 years old and at 23 years old, he already has experience in the cultivation of coffee and bananas as well as in the business of selling his products.  He has two parcels of land.  He has planted coffee on the bigger part of the land and bananas on only half a parcel.  He harvests the bananas every fifteen days, earning income twice per month.  The coffee requires more care but his annual harvest is more than rewarding.
“Each year my production grows. The last time I harvested eight sacks of coffee”, he mentions proudly.
Jimy knows what is suitable for him, and for this reason he will continue working the land by planting more coffee crops and varying his crops.  Having a wife and children is not his priority.  To grow as a person is his main concern.  This would be his first loan that he would obtain thanks to the help of MFP; therefore he accepts responsibility for being punctual with his monthly payments.  “Los Productores Yaneshas”, a part of the communal bank, has just formed and he feels excited about working in groups.  Receiving the money will enable Jimy to begin planting bananas and purchase small “mamones”(a native fruit) and bags of organic fertilizer to ensure healthy growth.

loans.use: to purchase banana plants and sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Teresa Maria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,ella vende polos,pantalones,blusas y casacas y tambien vende lenceria como truzas y medias,ella tiene un pequeño stand en el mercado donde vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local mas amplio donde pueda vender.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar polos,casacas,pantalones y blusas al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teresa Maria continues to sell clothing. She sells polo shirts, pants, blouses, and coats, and she also sells lingerie such as underwear and pantyhose. She has a small stand in the market where she sells from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. Her dream is to have a larger store where she can sell. She is asking for the loan to buy wholesale polo shirts, coats, pants, and blouses. 

She is happy for the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale polo shirts, coats, pants, and blouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Abeba

texts.en: Abeba is married and has 3 children. For 5 years, she has cooked and sold banku (a dish of fermented corn or cassava) in Mbem near Abura. Her husband is a driver. Abeba uses her income to support her husband in paying their children's school fees. Abeba will use the loan to purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of her banku. With the new profits, Abeba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of her banku.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa sells fried fish and salted fish in Mbeam near Elmina. Yaa has completed J.SS. (junior secondary schooling). She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa has been selling fish for 4 years. She supports her husband in paying their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase more fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua sells packaging bags in Mbeam near Abura. Akwa has completed her education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is an electrician. Akwa has been selling packaging bags for 2 years. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more packaging bags to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more packaging bags to sell.

loans.name: Uber

texts.es:
Uber de 28 años convive con Virginia. Con ella tiene a sus 2 hijos y razón de ser: Owen de 5 años y Juliana de 2 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Uber, hombre trabajador y emprendedor. A su edad ya es responsable de una familia, a quien mantiene. Al inició no fue fácil, pero gracias a la ayuda de sus padres quienes le otorgaron parcelas de terrenos pudo iniciar sus propios sembríos. Ahora él cuenta con plantaciones de café y plátanos. 
“Tengo una cuadra de café que me bota 5 sacos de 70 kilos cada uno”, explica. Uber vende sus granos de café a 10 soles el kilo, por ahora. En temporadas de gran demanda, como son los meses de abril a julio, su precio llega a costar hasta 14 soles.
En el campo recibe el apoyo incondicional de Virginia y confía que, con los años sus hijos también aprendan de las labores. Cuando hay trabajos esporádicos no duda en viajar hacia la ciudad de Lima, pero no descuida a su familia e hijos. Es por eso que seguirán trabajando para que ellos crezcan con valores y sin carencias básicas. 
Uber piensa alquilar más terrenos para ampliar sus sembríos. Sería la primera vez que Uber accedería a un préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Él pertenece a “Los Productores Yaneshas”, su banco comunal, del que espera progreso en equipo.
Con el dinero podrá contratar el personal necesario para renovar sus plantaciones de café, es decir cambiarlas de tierras más fértiles. Además comprará bolsas de abonos para esta acción.
texts.en:
Uber, 28, lives with his partner, Virgina and their reason for living, their two children: Owen, 5 and Juliana, 2.  They live in their own house in their native village, Villa María Alto Yurinaki, Chanchamayo province.  Uber is a hardworking and entrepreneurial man and at his age is already responsible for the family that he supports.  At the beginning it wasn’t easy but thanks to the help from his parents who offered them parcels of land, he could begin his own farming.  Now he has fields of coffee and plantains.
“I have a cuadra (an agricultural measure) of café that yields 5 sacks of 70 each” he explains.  Uber sells the coffee beans at 10 sols the kilo for now.  In the season of high demand, such as the months of April through July, the price reaches up to 14 sols.
He receives the unconditional help of  Virginia and he tells us that in the future his children will also learn farm work.  When there is sporadic work, he goes to Lima but he doesn’t neglect his family and children.  That is why he will continue working until they grow up with good values and with their basic needs taken care of.
Uber plans to rent more fields to increase his crops. This will be the first time that he has gotten a loan with MFP and he promises to be punctual with his monthly payments.  He belongs to the communal bank “Los Productores Yanesha” and he hopes to continue with the group.
He will use the money to hire workers to renew his coffee fields, that means to replace the dirt with more fertile soil.  He  will also buy fertilizer for this.

loans.use: to hire farm laborers and also to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more frozen meat, chicken, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of her banku.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua sells fanti kenkey (boiled maize dough) in Mbeam near Abura. Akosua has completed her education. She is married and has 8 children. Her husband is a farmer. Akosua has been selling fanti kenkey for 3 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy maize in bulk for the preparation of her banku (fermented maize paste). She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of her kenkey.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa operates a grocery shop in Mbem near Abura. She is married and has 2 children. Yaa has been operating her shop for 3 years. She is responsible for feeding and clothing her children and paying for their school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende arroz,azucar,leche,aceite entre otros productos,al socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member, Maritza Elizabeth, continues managing her grocery store business.  She sells rice, sugar, milk, oil, and other products.  She works from 7:00 am until 8:00 pm and wants to get ahead through this business.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale rice, sugar, milk, and oil to stock her grocery store.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale products such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groceries and other food items to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Loida

texts.es:
Loida de 31 años está felizmente casada con Pedro, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 11, 9, 7 y 3 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Loida se dedica ala agricultura en sus propios terrenos. Desde que unió su vida con Pedro emprendió esta ardua pero gratificante labor. Con el cultivo del café y el plátano le va muy bien y le da la posibilidad de generar ahorros para cualquier urgencia. “Tengo 5 cuadras, en 4 siembro café y solo en 1 plátanos”, menciona contenta de la extensión de sus terrenos.
Su prioridad es el cultivo de café por la gran demanda, pero para los gastos y necesidades diarias tiene que vender las arrobas de plátanos de sus cosechas. De 15 a 18 sacos son los que obtiene al cosechar el café, una producción nada ignorable. Le va muy bien en ese negocio.
Pero el proceso no es sencillo, el trabajo requiere tiempo y dedicación, para eso ella tiene que contratar personal para limpieza constante de sus cultivos.
Tiene muchos planes para el futuro, el más cercano es comprarse un carro de segunda mano para desplazarse con facilidad desde su comunidad hasta la ciudad. Para lograr esto deberá trabajar igual o más duro que ahora. Éste sería su primer préstamo que Loida obtendría gracias a su ayuda, de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Acaba de formar parte del banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”, del que se siente emocionada por el trabajo en grupos.
Cada año fertiliza 2 veces los sembríos de café, por eso Loida invertirá todo el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Loida is 31 years old and happily married to Pedro.  They have four children ages 11, 9, 7, and 3.  They live in their own home in the community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki, province of Chanchamayo.  Loida farms her own land.  When she joined her life with Pedro, she took on this arduous but rewarding work.  The cultivation of coffee and bananas is going very well and provides her with the possibility of generating savings for emergencies.  “I have five ‘cuadras’ (a unit of land measurement = roughly 1.5 acres), and I have planted coffee in four of them and bananas in the other one “, she says, pleased with the expanse of her land.  
Her priority is to cultivate coffee to meet the great demand.  However, in order to pay expenses and daily necessities, she has to sell arrobas (a unit of measure equal to 24-36 pounds, depending on the region) of bananas from their crops.  She harvests 15 to 18 sacks of coffee, quite a substantial production!  This business is going very well.  But the process isn’t simple.  The work requires time and dedication so she has to hire laborers for constant cleaning of her crops.  
She has many plans for the future; the most immediate is to buy a second hand car in order to move easily from their community to the city.  In order to achieve this goal, she will have to work as hard, or even harder than she does now.  This would be the first loan that Loida would obtain thanks to the help of MFP; therefore she accepts responsibility for being punctual with her monthly payments.  “Los Productores Yaneshas”, a part of the communal bank, has just formed and she feels excited about working in groups. Loida fertilizes the coffee crops twice per year.  For this reason, Loida will invest all of the money in the purchase of bags of organic fertilizer

loans.use: to purchase of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi sells fanti kenkey (boiled maize dough) in Mbeam near Abura. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer.  Asi has been selling fanti kenkey for 2 years. She supports her husband in paying their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy bulk maize for preparing kenkey to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of kenkey.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a  fish monger at Mbeam near Abura.   She is married and has 8 dependents.   Her husband is a chain saw operator.  Ama has been selling fish for 7 years now.  She supports her husband to pay their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Zenayda

texts.es:
Zenayda de 22 años, es una joven soltera y vive con sus padres en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Zenayda trabaja en distintas actividades. De niña la formaron en no conformarse con lo que tiene, siempre hay motivos para seguir trabajando y emprender.
Ella ayuda en los cultivos de sus padres. Son 2 parcelas las que cultivan con la siembra de café y plátanos. Ellos priorizan estos 2 productos por que el plátanos se cosecha cada quince días y su venta es inmediata, obteniendo ingresos para el día a día.
