El café es más rentable pero su producción es anual, permitiéndoles ahorrar y volver a invertir en próximas cosechas. Sus padres y hermanos también se dedican a esta actividad familiar. Le va bien en el negocio por esa razón quiere ampliar sus sembríos con la compra de viveros de café. Éste sería su primer préstamo que obtendría gracias a su ayuda de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Acaba de formar parte del banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”, del que se siente contenta y emocionada por el trabajo en grupos.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos y en el pago de de los jornaleros que contratará para plantar más café.
texts.en:
Zenayda, 22, is a single youth who lives with her parents in the indigenous community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki, in Chanchamayo province.  Zenayda does several types of work.  From the time she was a child, she was taught not to be satisfied with what she had, as there are always reasons to continue to work and to embark on new activities.  She helps her parents with their farming.  They have 2 parcels of land that they cultivate with coffee and bananas.  They give priority to these products because they can harvest bananas every 15 days and sell them immediately, which gives them daily earnings.  Coffee is more profitable, but it is grown on an annual cycle, allowing them to save and then invest in their next harvest.  Her parents and brothers also work on the family farm.  This business is going well, and so for this reason she wants to expand her plantings by purchasing coffee seedlings.  This will be the first loan that she will get, thanks to the help of MFP, and she will therefore be responsible for making her monthly loan payments.  She has just become a member of the communal bank “Los Productores Yaneshas,” and she feels excited and pleased about working in a group.

She will use this money to invest in sacks of organic fertilizer and to pay the workers that she will hire to plant more coffee.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and to hire farmworkers

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 29 años, se describe como una persona luchadora, responsable, trabajadora que siempre busca el bienestar de sus hijos. María vive con sus dos hijos en Machachi en la provincia de Pichincha.

María trabaja sola en la crianza de animales como pollos, cuyes. Trabaja en este negocio ya que es el único ingreso para su familia, realiza su segundo crédito para poder construir galpones para sus animales ya que se le estaban perdiendo y eso ocacionaba pérdidas y bajos ingresos. Con esta inversión podrá tener seguros a sus animales y criarlos de mejor manera. Los buenos ingresos económicos a María ayudan a mantener a sus hijos y darles una buena educación.

María tiene la visión de comprar una vaca para entrar al negocio de la leche para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 29 year-old woman who describes herself as tenacious, responsible and hardworking.  She is always seeking to provide for the well-being of her children.  Maria lives with her 2 children in Machachi in Pichincha province.

Maria works alone raising animals such as chickens and guinea pigs.  She works in this business because it is the only source of income for her family.  She is taking her 2nd loan to build sheds for her animals, since she has been losing some of them, and this has caused economic losses for her.  With this investment she will be able to have better security for her animals and raise them in a better way.  Maria's good income helps her to support her children and give them a good education.

Maria envisions buying a cow to enter the milk business so that she could improve the quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to build sheds for her chickens, because she doesn't have a secure place for them to prevent them from being stolen

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is single and has 4 children.  She sells fanti kenkey at Mbem near Abura, which she has done for 10 years. Efua uses her income to help her husband to pay their children's school fees. Efua will use the loan to purchase bulk maize to prepare her kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ayetuah plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel de 30 años convive con Edith con quien tiene 3 hijos de 9, 8 y 2 años de edad. Ellos viven en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Pichanaki por el estudio de sus hijos, pero cuentan con una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Samuel cuenta con terrenos de cultivos en la comunidad de Villa María, ahí están sus sembríos de café, palta y plátanos. Son 3 parcelas donde distribuye estos productos. Los cuidados para sus sembríos son constantes, por eso debe recurrir a personal para que trabajen sus tierras.  Labora de la mano de Edith, ella prepara los alimentos para los operarios, y además también coge las herramientas para limpiar la mala yerba del café.
La cosecha de plátanos le da ingresos constantes por que son cada quince días. En ese lapso obtiene 500 kilos, los que vende a 70 céntimos cada kilo.
 “Me gusta sentirme ocupado. Con lo que hago me siento bien. De manera decente puedo brindarle a mi familia lo necesario para vivir”, comenta orgulloso. Este sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por lo que agradece de antemano el apoyo. Se siente contento de pertenecer a ”Los Productores Yaneshas”, su banco comunal, por que sabe que en equipo los resultados serán mayores. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos para su producción de café. Cada bolsa está de 110 a 120 soles.
texts.en:
Samuel, 30, lives with Edith, and together they have 3 children aged 9, 8 and 2.  They live in a rented home in the city of  Pichanaki in order for their children to go to school there, but they have their own home in the indigenous community of Villa Maria in Chanchamayo province.  Samuel has land that he cultivates in the community of Villa Maria where he grows coffee, avocado and bananas.  He has 3 parcels of land where these crops are grown.  His crops require constant care, and so for this reason he must rely on workers to farm his lands.  He works alongside Edith; she prepares the food for the farmworkers and also takes the tools to clear the weeds from the coffee crops.

The banana harvest provides him with constant earnings, because the fruit is harvested every 15 days.  Each harvest you get 500 kilos, which sells at 70 cents per kilo. "I like to be busy.  I feel good about what I do.  In an honorable way, I can provide my family with what they need to live," he comments proudly.  This will be his first loan with MFP, and so he gives his thanks in advance for this support.  He feels content to belong to ”Los Productores Yaneshas," his communal bank, because he knows that working as a team they will get better results.  He will invest this money in the purchase of sacks of organic fertilizer for his coffee crops.  Every sack costs about 110-120 Peruvian soles.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy maize to prepare kenkey

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria del Rosario tiene 52 años de edad, la actividad económica  a la que se dedica es a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de la localidad tiene un puesto donde atiende a sus clientes fijos y eventuales que la visitan, ella ya tiene años de experiencia en el cual sus clientes la buscan ya que el producto que les ofrece es fresco y la atención que les brinda es buena. Maria del Rosario está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de frutas y verduras y poder brindarle a sus clientes variedad de producto.
texts.en: Maria del Rosario is 52 years old. Her economic activity is selling fruit and vegetables in the community market. She has a spot where she serves her regular and new customers. She has years of experience and her customers seek her out because the products she offers are fresh and her service is good. Maria del Rosario is asking for a loan to invest in her business selling fruit and vegetables so she can offer her customers a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy maize and plantains

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo de 36 años convive con María, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 17, 12, 8 y 6 años. Todos viven juntos en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Segundo es un hombre alegre por que se dedica a algo que le gusta mucho hacer. Creció rodeado de la naturaleza y plantaciones de frutas. Es por eso que aprendió como se realiza los sembríos. Él y María trabajan arduamente en el campo, en sus 5 parcelas de terrenos de terrenos donde cultiva café, plátanos y yucas.
“En 2 cuadras tengo café y al año me bota de 60 a 70 latas, cada lata de 8 kilos”, menciona, añadiendo que de esa manera obtiene mayores ingresos. Las faenas son cansadas y absorbentes, es así que requieren contratar operarios a quienes paga al día.  Más adelante, quisiera extender sus terrenos. Tendrá que ahorrar para adquirirlos o por lo menos los arrendará. Así podrá brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida en cuanto a vestido, educación y alimentación. “Mis hijos son mi principal razón se seguir adelante”, dice. Ésta es la primera vez que Segundo accedería a un préstamo de MFP, gracias a su ayuda. Se compromete a ser puntual en la pago de las cuotas. “Los Productores Yaneshas” es el nombre de su reciente banco comunal, siente que en grupo lograrán mayores resultados. Invertirá el dinero del préstamo en la compra de 10 bolsas de abonos de 120 soles cada una. Segundo ya cuenta con un pequeño capital y gracias al préstamo podrá lograr ésta compra.
texts.en:
Segundo is 36 years old. He lives with María, with whom he has 4 children, aged 17, 12, 8 and 6 years old. They all live together in their ow home in the indigenous community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki, in the province of Chanchamayo. Segundo is a cheerful man who work in something he really likes to do. He grew up surrounded by nature and fruit plantations. That is how he learned to grow his crops. He and María work hard in the fields on their 5 parcels of land where they grow coffee, plantains and yucca.

“On two lots I have coffee and it yields 60 to 70 cans a year. Each can weighs 8 kilos", he remarks. He adds that this is how he gets most of his income. The work is tiring and absorbing, so they need to hire various laborers whom they pay daily. In the future, he would like to extend his land. He will have to save to acquire it, or at least rent it. That way he will be able to offer his children a better quality of life in respect to clothing, education and food. “My children are my main reason for going ahead", he says. This is the first time that Segundo will access a loan from MFP, thanks to your help.He is committed to making his payments on time. “Los Productores Yaneshas” is the name of his new communal bank. He feels that as a group they will achieve greater results. He will invest the money from the loan in buying 10 bags of fertilizer, 120 soles each. Segundo already has an account with a little bit of capital and thanks to the loan, he can make this purchase.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis sells fire wood and second-hand clothing at Abuenu.  His educational background was up to middle form 4.  He is married and has 5 children.  His wife is a trader.  Francis has been selling firewood and second-hand clothing for two years now. He uses his income to take care of his children and their school fees as well.  His loan will be used to purchase more firewood and second-hand clothing to sell. He would like to use the profit he will get from the business to cater for his children`s school fees.

loans.use: buy firewood and second-hand clothing

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells cooded rice and serves it with meat and fish stew at Abuenu. Efua is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been selling cooded rice for 10 years. She supports her husband to feed their children. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice, oil, meat, fish and other ingredients for the preparation of the cooded rice for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, oil, meat, fish and other ingredients

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende arroz,azucar,leche,aceite y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar la tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz,azucar y leche al por mayor para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is still working in her grocery store business. She sells rice, sugar, milk, oil, and cookies. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. With this business, she gets her children ahead. Her dream is to enlarge and improve her store. She is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar and milk wholesale to stock her grocery store. 

This member is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and milk wholesale to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías de 22 años de edad, es un joven soltero y vive con sus padres en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Elías se dedica a la agricultura. Cuando fue niño sus padres le enseñaron sobre esta actividad y fiel a sus enseñanzas, ahora él trabaja la tierra. En sus 2 parcelas de terrenos propios siembra café y plátanos. Sus productos los comercializa en las ciudades de Yurinaki y Pichanaki. Hasta esos lugares llegan los compradores para adquirir café bueno y plátanos sanos y carnosos.
Elías es consiente que también necesita estudiar alguna carrera técnica, no descarta la idea de hacerlo realidad. Mientras tanto continuará con su labor, para eso requiere el apoyo de sus hermanos ó contrata jornaleros a quienes paga diariamente. Una de sus metas es construir su casa propia, para cuando tenga su propia familia. Sería la primera vez que Elías recibiría un préstamo de MFP, por eso muestra firmeza al mencionar que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los productores Yaneshas”, es su reciente banco comunal, siente que en grupo sus logros serán mayores. Elías necesita 4 bolsas de abonos orgánicos para su cafetal. Gastará alrededor de 450 soles. Lo restante lo invertirá en el pago de los jornaleros para la limpieza de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Elías is 22 years old. He is a young, single man who lives with his parents in the indigenous community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki in the province of  Chanchamayo. Elías works in agriculture. When he was a child, his parents taught him about this activity, and faithful to his learning, he now works the earth. On his two parcels of his own land, he grows coffee and plantains. He sells his products in the cities of Yurinaki and Pichanaki. Buyers go to those places to acquire good coffee and healthy, fleshy plantains.

Elias is aware that he also needs to study some sort of technical trade and he is not discarding the idea of making this reality. Meanwhile, he will continue his work, and for that he needs his brothers' support, or he will hire laborers whom he has to pay daily. One of his goals is to build his own house, for when he has his own family. This will be the first time he has received a loan from MFPm and that is why he firmly states that he will make his payments on time. “Los Productores Yaneshas” is his new communal bank. He feels that in a group, he will have grater achievements. Elías needs 4 bags of organic fertilizer for his coffee crop. He will spend around 450 soles. The rest he will invest in paying the laborers to clear his land.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and hire laborers.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is a trader who sells cooked yams and other groceries at Abuenu. Araba has completed J.S.S. She is married and has 6 dependents. Her husband is a tailor.  

Araba has been selling cooked yams for a year now. She supports her husband to feed their children. She will use her loan to buy more yams and groceries to bring variety to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more yams and groceries to bring variety to her customers

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "QORIMANKACHA"; Este banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y en el departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Beatriz; la socia tiene 47 años de edad, la socia apoya aún a sus hijos y ella es casada y la socia es docente de profesion en el area inicial y se dedica a la compra y venta de autopartes, la socia alterna de este modo sus actividades y mejora su ingreso economico,. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de autopartes. 



La socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank "QORIMANKACHA".  This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco, and in the department of Cusco.

The partner is Beatriz. She is 47 years old.  She supports her children, and she is married.  She is a professional teacher in the first place, and she buys and sells auto parts.  The partner alternates her activities in this way and improves her income.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of auto parts.

The partner promises to follow through with the payment of her dues in the established time.

loans.use: to invest in auto parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an acacia plantation for the production of charcoal

loans.name: Mery Anselma

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Mery Anselma; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de golosinas, tales como chupetes, caramelos, chocolates y galletas, gaseosas, yogurth, snacks entre otros, la socia en esta ocasión desea el credito para invertir en la compra de mercaderia para implementar su negocio y poder seguir creciendo y apoyar a la familia.
texts.en: The member is Mery Anselma. She continues in her business buying and selling sweets like lollipops, hard candies, chocolate and cookies, as well as sodas, yogurt and snacks among other things. In this occasion, she is requesting the loan to invest in merchandise to stock her business and to continue growing and supporting the family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cassava for the production of her gari for sale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married and has 4 children. She sells fried fish at Abuenu, which she has done for 4 years. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in paying utility bills. Efua will use the loan to buy more fish to fry for sale. With the new profits from her business, Efua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Felicitas;  La socia continua con su negocio de ferretería, ella sigue implementando su ferreteria con la compra de clavos, pinturas, martillos entre otras herramientas. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas para implementar su negocio y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: The member is Felicitas. She continues in her hardware business.  She continues setting up her hardware store by buying nails, paint, and hammers among other tools. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of tools to further set up her business and improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her hardware store, such as nails, paint, nuts, and hammers.

loans.name: Hugo Roberto

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de hospedaje,el trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de hospedaje.El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar su hospedaje y comprar camas y sabanas al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues his lodging business. He works from 8am until 6pm. With this business, he is getting his children ahead. His dream is to expand and improve his lodging business. He is requesting the loan to further set-up his business and buy beds and sheets wholesale.
He is happy because of the loan and promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: o further set-up his business and buy beds and sheets wholesale.
